<h2>FAILURE!</h2> The way is complex and requires every reflex you have. Often, (print: $animal)'s direction changes swiftly and without warning. It is on one of these occasions that your hand is not quick to the cue, and your companion gives a violent cry. Your ship is pulled and keels port-wards violently, suddenly riding the frothing edges of the Bifrost. You cry out in fear and desperately pull the rudder to, but it is ripped from your grasp. Your ship founders and plunges off the edge of the river and into the abyss. You fall and fall and fall without stopping. A high uncanny laugh echoes through all creation: of a madwoman avenged on all things and the author of every end. Above in the arching sky you see the blackened branches of Ygrassil consumed as if the turn of time has been shot from a bow. Up and up the blackness travels, to the crown where Asgard rests. A rending groan runs through the World Tree, and the branches sag. Points of burning light, brighter than a thousand suns, begin to run along a million veins in its withered bark, that widen and strain. You can see them. The branches holding the Nine Worlds sag and slide and begin to dissipate like burning ash thrown up by the wind. A mighty crash, and the sound of every voice of every being that was or is or will be calls out in fear, and is no more. The tree splits through it's mighty trunk from it's tips to the base of every root. All falls. All burns. All is ended. All is dark. All but Odin's arm, which leans through all and catches the arrow of time, pulling it back again to the bow. Undoing become renewing and all is reversed, and you find yourself back in your bed, Odin's voice in your ear: “Come, sons and daughters. Gather to me, for I have plans and purposes for you. Come, rise and make ready before the dawning sun…” BEGIN THE STORY AGAIN! PERHAPS THIS TIME THE DICE WILL FAVOR YOU! [[DAY 1]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> (print: $animal) guides you well, and you follow the waterways upward to the crown of Ygdrassil. The mighty mouth of the Bifrost runs downwards from the gates of Asgard - Great pearlescent pillars of marble and jade stretch impossibly over the rainbow flow. Beyond, in the safe harbor of Asgard, seven ships are moored together; one adventurer for each of the worlds set before you. You make yours fast to the floatilla, and find your way to the shores. The servants of Odin have gathered here, in this last moment where the fate of all hangs in the balance. On the white sanded shores Odin stands before you. He is not imposing like the Giants of Jotunheim, and his power does not come from his lordship over worlds. Instead he is the stature of any man, dressed in the furs of a wolf, and quiet as the morning. But he is also everywhere - fully present to all things and for all things and through all things. Present as the mountain is when you live in its shadow. "Welcome warriors; sons and daughters all! You have done well, and my heart is gladdened by your coming to these shores! The hour has come for the turning of fate. You have all learned of Sigyn's betrayal, and of the poison of Jormungandr's Fangs that wends its way through Ygdrassil's veins even now. I still know not what twisting would turn her heart to the killing of the World Tree, but it falls to you still to make right this wrong. Once more I ask your aid." ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D8) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 20->DAY 20]]<h2>APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY</h2> You consider with care, then speak: "Great Freyr, Lord of Light, and Council of Ljosalfar, Well you know that Odin, keeper of the Nine Realms, has appointed that Alfheim should be the jewel that crowns the World Tree. The peace, prosperity, and joy of your shining domain are woven into the tapestry of order maintained by his will. When the Great Tree, Yggdrasil, is threatened, that threat is a direct challenge to the authority and design of Odin himself." "Odin has seen what you all have felt. The trembling in the limbs of the Great Tree speaks of a blight, spreading from every realm into the limbs and roots of it. Doom is near, and not that foretold as Ragnarok. No, this doom is of utter oblivion. The wisdom of the All-Father is without equal, and he has decreed that every being, from the Æsir in Asgard to the Light Elves in this very hall, has a role to play in the turning back of the blight. Long your domain has been set apart as the home and hope of peace, sustained by the stories and songs of hope streaming up from Realms below. The time has come to honor the sustenance of Odin and of all creation. Will you join your will to the All-Father and All-Mother, and aid me in the healing of the World Tree? Will you prove yourselves worthy of the All-Father's favor, or will you allow divine order to perish through your inaction?" ROLL FOR PERSUASION - Medium DC. The Light Elves do consider themselves as keepers of beauty. They will be somewhat swayed by this argument. (set: $ACharm to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! You struggle with desperation to nudge your body and the wreckage to which you cling into the way your companion has indicated, but it is not enough. Instead your body is thrown towards the frothing edges of the Bifrost. You cry out in fear and desperately paddle against the treacherous waters, but to no avail. You are flung off the edge of the river and into the abyss. You fall and fall and fall without stopping. A high uncanny laugh echoes through all creation: of a madwoman now avenged on all things and the author of every end. Above in the arching sky you see the blackened branches of Ygrassil consumed as if the turn of time has been shot from a bow. Up and up the blackness travels, to the crown where Asgard rests. A rending groan runs through the World Tree, and the branches sag. Points of burning light, brighter than a thousand suns, begin to run along a million veins in its withered bark, that widen and strain. You can see them. The branches holding the Nine Worlds sag and slide and begin to dissipate like burning ash thrown up by the wind. A mighty crash, and the sound of every voice of every being that was or is or will be calls out in fear, and is no more. The tree splits through it's mighty trunk from it's tips to the base of every root. All falls. All burns. All is ended. All is dark. All but Odin's arm, which leans through all and catches the arrow of time, pulling it back again to the bow. Undoing become renewing and all is reversed, and you find yourself back in your bed, Odin's voice in your ear: “Come, sons and daughters. Gather to me, for I have plans and purposes for you. Come, rise and make ready before the dawning sun…” BEGIN THE STORY AGAIN! PERHAPS THIS TIME THE DICE WILL FAVOR YOU! [[DAY 1]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> Your companion guides you well, and by some twisting of providence the waterways send you upward to the crown of Ygdrassil. You are thrown after long hours into the headwaters of the Bifrost, that run downwards from the gates of Asgard. Great pearlescent pillars of marble and jade stretch impossibly over the rainbow flow. Beyond, in the safe harbor of Asgard, seven ships are moored together; one adventurer for each of the worlds set before you. You find your way to the shores, and pull yourself, exhausted, on to the soft sand. You rest there a moment, but very soon you find yourself restored. The air of Asgard is quick to revive you, and before long you find you are able to stand. Before you is a company of seven warriors of Midgard like yourself. The servants of Odin have gathered here, in this last moment where the fate of all hangs in the balance. Odin stands before you all. He is not imposing like the Giants of Jotunheim, and his power does not come from his lordship over worlds. Instead he is the stature of any man, dressed in the furs of a wolf, and quiet as the morning. But he is everywhere - fully present to all things and for all things and through all things. Present as the mountain is when you live in its shadow. "Welcome warriors; sons and daughters all! You have done well, and my heart is gladdened by your coming to these shores! The hour has come for the turning of fate. You have all learned of Sigyn's betrayal, and of the poison of Jormungandr's Fangs that wends its way through Ygdrassil's veins even now. I still know not what twisting would turn her heart to the killing of the World Tree, but it falls to you still to make right this wrong. Once more I ask your aid." ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D8) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 20->DAY 20]]<h2>STRIKE A DEAL WITH THE SONGCOURT</h2> You consider carefully, then speak: "Great Freyr, Lord of Light, your power over growth, sun, and prosperity is clear to all. I have not come to you as a beggar, but as one who appreciates the value of immortal beauty. The rot on Yggdrasil is spreading, and if the Tree falls, the structure of reality will shatter. When all the Nine Worlds descend into silence, even the memory of Álfheimr—your shining halls, your artistry, your magnificent light—will be lost." "This is the opportunity to secure something more valuable than mere survival: eternal renown and the bounty of unending song. Lend us your aid in the healing of the World Tree, and Asgard and Midgard will pledge that, for all time, the greatest Skalds of our two realms will compose and sing eternal songs of joy and glory for Álfheim. Your victory will be woven into the very fabric of cosmic history, ensuring that the Ljósálfar's beauty and nobility are praised in every realm, in every age to come. This enduring song will be your monument and sustenance, raised to you by grateful voices forever. You will not merely survive the chaos; you will become the immortal subject of the most glorious poetry ever known." ROLL FOR PERSUASION - High DC. The Light Elves would look with contempt on such low bargaining. (set: $ACharm to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $ACharm,"") (link: "Submit Number")[ (set: _inputNum to (num: $ACharm)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die2A") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 14)[ (go-to: "ACharmPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 14)[ (go-to: "ACharmFAIL") ] ]<h2>GOAD THE SONGCOURT WITH CONTEMPT</h2> You take a deliberate step towards the table, and stare across the table at Freyr and his Council. "I have seen your realm—it is a jewel, certainly, but one kept in a velvet box. You were granted this kingdom as a tooth-gift from Odin Himself and you have ruled it as such, luxuriating in a peace that has made you complacent. You sit here, shining and beautiful, while the Tree and the Realms below are blighted and wither away. Sooner than you think, your realm will starve, for the songs that sustain it will be silenced. And not long after the sapphire sky above you will be torn away, as the great branches of Ygdrassil let you fall into oblivion." Let me be clear: When the Tree dies and the realms collapse, your light will not be a beacon of hope; it will be a candle in a tidal wave, extinguished without a flicker of acknowledgment. You will not be remembered, and your passing will not be mourned. You will be swallowed by a darkness that knows nothing of your sun or your songs. "Join your will to mine and Odin's, to turn back the blight on Ygdrassil, or accept that the Lords of Álfheim are nothing more than the final, beautiful ornament on a world that dies in pampered silence." ROLL FOR INTIMIDATION - HIGH DC, The Songcourt are a proud group, and will not appreciate the contempt. (set: $ACharm to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $ACharm,"") (link: "Submit Number")[ (set: _inputNum to (num: $ACharm)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die2A") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 16)[ (go-to: "ACharmPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 16)[ (go-to: "ACharmFAIL") ] ]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> A ripple of whispers passes through the assembled Council, like the first breeze before the storm's howl. A younger Light-Elf stands quickly and with anger in his voice. He tall and strong and full of the swirling boundless energy of youth. "Permit me, Lord, to speak. This mortal has brought evil to our realm. Indeed, he stinks of it! We are the keepers of peace and joy, and these two great mandates are maintained only by the expulsion of their opposites. For the sake of not only justice, but also for the preservation of the holiness of this place, we should expel this one or kill him with all haste!" Mutterings again fill the room from the assembled Songcourt. At length, one of the elder elves of the court stands. His face is as clean and smooth as a youth's, but his eyes have the depths of ages, and his hair is long and white. "So certain are you, that no story worthy of our ears dwells in this mortal. Of all peoples, we should most easily see wisdom in the fulness of every story. Let us hear this tale, and then pass our judgements, regardless of the offenses done. There is time yet for at least one more song to be sung." Freyr has thus far sat in silence and considered the counsel of the Elves, but the god’s expression hardens. The sunlight that usually radiates from him focuses into a blinding, all-seeing luminescence. "You speak of sickness and the need for aid, mortal, yet you approach us with hands stained with the blood of my realm. You come begging for the protection of this Great Tree, yet you yourself represent the careless, short-sighted violence that contributes to the spreading disorder. You appeal to our sense of order and our honor, but you honor nothing!" "You claim the cosmos is dying, but I see a disease that cannot truly touch us. The flaws you describe—the fragility of Yggdrasil, the encroaching shadows—are merely the predictable result of the Æsir's ill-conceived design. Our light is eternal. Our prosperity is boundless. While you flail wildly against the inevitable decay, we will use the wisdom of the Vanir to protect our own source of life, to ensure Álfheimr remains a true sanctuary, unmarred by your fleeting wars and panic." "Go, mortal. Go back to your collapsing world, and take the chaos you breed with you. For Odin's sake we will stay our hand for a single hour. But following that, the light of Alfheim will not comfort you, but burn your flesh, and drain from you your life, your warmth, and your memory, leaving only a withered husk to be returned to your foolish gods." Freyr gestures a sharp cutting dismissal, and you flee from the hall, the weight of the Soungcourt's profound rejection following you like dogs after prey. A younger Light-Elf stands quickly and with anger in his voice. He tall and strong and full of the swirling boundless energy of youth. "Permit me, Lord, to speak. This mortal has brought evil to our realm. Indeed, he stinks of it! We are the keepers of peace and joy, and these two great mandates are maintained only by the expulsion of their opposites. For the sake of not only justice, but also for the preservation of the holiness of this place, we should expel this one or kill him with all haste!" Mutterings again fill the room from the assembled Songcourt. At length, one of the elder elves of the court stands. His face is as clean and smooth as a youth's, but his eyes have the depths of ages, and his hair is long and white. "So certain are you, that no story worthy of our ears dwells in this mortal. Of all peoples, we should most easily see wisdom in the fulness of every story. Let us hear this tale, and then pass our judgements, regardless of the offenses done. There is time yet for at least one more song to be sung." Freyr sits in silence, hearing these counsels. He then regards you steadily for long moments, "So be it, mortal. Tell us what you know of the blight of the World Tree." You give him an account, of the failing of the Ygdrassil, and of your journey thus far. When complete, he sits a long time, deep in thought. Finally he rises, "I thank you each for your wisdom this day. The Songcourt is concluded. Leave us. Come, mortal. Walk with me. We have much to discuss..." There is great haste in his dismissal, and your suspicions are awakened. [[CONTINUE->DAY 14AS]](set: _inputAum to (num: $ADirAumber)) Process Input (if: _inputAum is 1)[ (set: $Adir to "AAorth") (go-to: "ANorth") ] (else-if: _inputAum is 2)[ (set: $Adir to "AWest") (go-to: "AWest") ] (else-if: _inputAum is 3)[ (set: $Adir to "ASouth") (go-to: "ASouth") ] (else-if: _inputAum is 4)[ (set: $Adir to "AEast") (go-to: "AEast") ] (else:)[ (set: $Adir to "Error") (go-to: "Potato is not a direction...6") ] [[ANorth]] [[AWest]] [[ASouth]] [[AEast]] [[Potato is not a direction...6]]You consider tasting the water on your tongue, and though your thirst is great, you set your eyes to the moving horizon. This is still a strange land, and it would be best to proceed with healthy caution. You sail on across the silvery sea, and by slow degrees your sense of this world changes, as if the essence of this place slowly invades you. It does not hurt, so you make no effort to fight it. Waves lap and climb on your ship, and the wind plays and buffets you, and as they do they take on a new character. They are songs and stories made manifest in mighty forest - the beauty and joy of the worlds below filtered through the deep waters of Alftheim and made manifest in the movements of wind and sea! You can, by straining your ear, hear individual songs in the whistle of the breeze: Songs from the giants about the might of stone and ice. Songs of your people about the first days of spring. Gentle songs of mothers to calm the restless child. Songs at hearth and after battle. You feel each and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! [[DAY 10->DAY 10AE]]You regard the water running down your hand, and raise it to your lips with no small fear. But it's taste is sweet to your lips, and as you consume it, your eyes and ears are awakened. You watch and hear the world you saw through Midgard's eyes take on its full glory. What were the uncanny waves of a foreign sea are revealed. These are songs and laughter and play made manifest! You can hear the shouts of young sons, running to embrace homecoming fathers. You can taste the laughter of daughters dancing with unfettered joy in soft grass! You can hear songs from the children of giants hoping to hold the hammers of their fathers, and of children of elves, light and dark, singing of the warmth of the sun. Gentle songs of mothers to calm the restless child. You feel each, and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES! She is the might of the wind incarnate, and the Eitr of golden song and story flows around her as an adornment of royalty. You know this beast from the elders' stories: This is Falki, winged protector of Alfheim. Her coming is blessing indeed. With her as your companion, the wrath of the Songcourt cannot touch you. (set: $animal to "Falki") [[CONTINUE TO DAY 16->DAY 16AT]]<h2>INTIMIDATE THE SONGCOURT</h2> You choose your words with care: "Yggdrasil is dying. You all know this as well as I, for I am certain you have felt it in the bitterness of stories filtering up from the realms below. A great blight lies on the World Tree, and I am tasked with finding its source in this realm as Champion of All-Father and All-Mother. If the World Tree should fall, there will be no Alfheim. The tales and songs that feed this glorious land will disappear, and your peace will wither on the vine and be nor more. There will only be the unmaking. This radiant realm, your people, your harvests, and even your own divinity will be utterly erased, a speck of dust lost to the primordial void that precedes all creation. "Join your will with mine and with the Aesgir. Look to the defense of all realms in this most desperate hour. Our need is great, as is yours!" ROLL FOR INTIMIDATION - LOW DC. You speak the truth, insofar as you know it, and the Songcourt will see the wisdom of your words. (set: $ACharm to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! Our world is marred by strife and suffering, but still we send songs wending upwards to sustain this place, knowing that a place of purest beauty and peace exists. I have been here mere hours, and it is all that my imaginings believed and more! But even this place is bound to the order of things by the great limbs of the World Tree. And you know as well as I that it trembles and falters. Odin as sent me to this realm because of this trembling. There is a blight on Ygdrassil. A foul sickness spreads through its roots, threatening to unravel the very tapestry of existence. Surely the God of Peace and Plenty, and his Council of Light can see that the fate of this glorious domain is tied to the fate of the Tree. If Yggdrasil falls, the sapphire sky above you will crumble, and the songs and stories that suffuse this land will be silenced forever. Let your great wisdom govern your wills. Join your cause to the All-Father and All-Mother, that by your hand and theirs the Great Tree can be restored! ROLL FOR PERSUASION - Low DC. The Light Elves do consider themselves as keepers of beauty. The will be somewhat swayed by this argument. (set: $ACharm to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $ACharm,"") (link: "Submit Number")[ (set: _inputNum to (num: $ACharm)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die2A") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 5)[ (go-to: "ACharmPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 5)[ (go-to: "ACharmFAIL") ] ]<h2>APPEAL TO THE SONGCOURT'S HONOR</h2> You consider carefully, then speak: "Great Freyr, and noble Elves of the Light, I come to you not as a stranger, but as a man who understands the unbreakable bond of kinship. I bring a warning that should stir the deepest parts of your heart, for it concerns the family that binds your very existence." "The World Tree, Yggdrasil, sickens. Its roots rot, its leaves wither, and a blight infects its veins. Do you not feel the tremors? Your sister, the mighty goddess Freyja, stares into a coming oblivion and has joined her cause with ours. And your father, the powerful Njörd, God of the Sea, has his domain and his very essence—the calm of the waters—threatened by the inevitable chaos of the Tree's fall. Would you stand aside and watch your sister and father suffer the unmaking of their worlds? Furthermore, you are a god, a tribe whose code of honor is steeped in the defense of life and the natural order. To allow the primordial source of life to perish while your power to save it remains unused would be the greatest dishonor imaginable, staining the beautiful legacy of Álfheimr forever." "Your duty extends beyond merely governing this shining realm; it is to the very lineage that gave you your light and your lordship. The endless cycles of peace and fertility that you command exist because of the ordered cosmos which Yggdrasil sustains. If you allow the Tree to fall, you betray the blood that runs in your veins, and you violate the sacred honor of the Vanir people. Your power over the sun and growth is not a luxury—it is a responsibility. I ask you, Freyr, will you not lend us your aid in service of your own kin and your eternal honor? Or will you stand by and watch the family of the Aesgir plunge into nothingness?" ROLL FOR PERSUASION - Medium DC. The Light Elves will be somewhat swayed by this argument. (set: $ACharm to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $ACharm,"") (link: "Submit Number")[ (set: _inputNum to (num: $ACharm)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die2A") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 11)[ (go-to: "ACharmPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 11)[ (go-to: "ACharmFAIL") ] ]Suddenly and everywhere the voice of Odin rings, as it did in your head a scant few days ago. "Stay your anger, brother. This one is here by my hand. You have surely felt the tremblings of the World Tree. You know as well as I that Ygdrassil's life hangs in the balance, and with it our fates as well. Listen to the warrior. They will speak in my stead, for my power wanes, and my voice fails at this reach." And his presence is gone. Freyr's eyes turn and bore into you. "You have disquieted my realm and slain one of the guardians of my seas. My anger burns, Maor, but for the sake of the All-Father I will stay my hand - for now. You will appear to the Songcourt." In a flash the horizon disappears to your sight and is replaced by a hall of gleaming white marble. The light of the moon pours in through open arches, and inside the luminous stones light the halls with subtle glow. This is the Citadel of Ljos. Eight counsellors sit at the table, bedecked in the robes of their office. Each is distinct and all radiate power. And, at the head of the table sits the mighty frame of Freyr, ruler of Alfheim. His piercing stare hold you frozen in place, before he speaks... KEEP THE DIE (A D12) FROM TODAY FOR YOUR INSPIRATION POOL - ODIN'S PRESENCE IS WITH YOU! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 13->DAY 13A]]Suddenly and everywhere the voice of Odin rings, as it did in your head a scant few days ago. "Stay your hand, Ljosalfar. This one is here by my hand, and should you harm him I will reave the life from you where you stand. You will take him to the Songcourt and give him leave to speak. This is our will." And with that his voice is gone. Reluctantly, the assembled soldiers gather, and form a cold and silent escort. Any questions are rebuffed with silence or grunts of indifference. After several hours of ascending the city, you come to the great citadel of Ljos. After a time spent waiting, you are granted an audience with the Songcourt. Eight counsellors sit at the table, bedecked in the robes of their office. Each is distinct and all radiate power. At the head of the table sits a ninth figure: Freyr, the ruler of this great realm. Robes of living sunlight flow and swirl up a strong, graceful form, revealing skin that shines like polished bronze and eyes that burn with the blue of a midday sky. His voice moves through the air, resonant like the great peal of a thousand titanic bells... KEEP THE DIE (A D12) FROM TODAY FOR YOUR INSPIRATION POOL - ODIN'S PRESENCE IS WITH YOU! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 13->DAY 13A]]You consider the brilliant sap, but after a moment's consideration you brush it off of your fingers on the tree and move on. There is no telling what it might do to you. Though beautiful, this is is a strange land, and not to be taken as safe because of it's shine. PRUDENCE IS THE BETTER PART OF VALOR - YOU SUFFER NO ILL EFFECT! You walk on through the forest, and by slow degrees your sense of this world changes, as if the essence of this place slowly invades you. It does not hurt, so you make no effort to fight it. Veins of sap and illuminated moss on the ground speak, and indeed sing and shine. They are songs and stories made manifest in mighty forest - the beauty and joy of the worlds below filtered through the earth of Alftheim and drawn up into root and branch! As you run you hand along the smooth beech-bark of the trees, you can, by straining your ear, hear individual songs: Songs from the giants about the might of stone and ice. Songs of your people about the first days of spring. Gentle songs of mothers to calm the restless child. Songs at hearth and after battle. You feel each and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFLHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES! [[DAY 10->DAY 10AN]]The taste of the sap is the embrace of a brother after long absence, or the gentle shush of your beloved after waking in the night. As you consume it, your eyes and ears are awakened. You watch and hear the forest you saw through Midgard's eyes take on its full glory. Veins of sap and illuminated moss on the ground speak, and indeed sing and shine. They are songs and stories made manifest in mighty forest - the beauty and joy of the worlds below filtered through the earth of Alftheim and drawn up into root and branch! As you run you hand along the smooth beech-bark, you can, by straining your ear, hear individual songs: Songs from the giants about the might of stone and ice. Songs of your people about the first days of spring. Gentle songs of mothers to calm the restless child. Songs at hearth and after battle. You feel each and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES! ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY (A D12) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL, TO USE IN AID OF A FUTURE TASK OF YOUR CHOOSING! [[DAY 10->DAY 10AN]]<h2>NORTH - The Luminous Woods</h2> You swing the tiller landward, and your ship heels to your turn. You find a small cove, where the ripples of the placid ocean caress the roots of great trees. You beach your craft, and head inland into the woods. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 9->Day 9AN]]Two Ash Fiends rise from the bubbling molten rock, leering at you with fanged maws. Their long claws scrape across the ground like metal on rock. They stalk you menacingly, and then plunge after you with impossibly long strides, screeching thoughtlessly! You find a rise in the land beside a great rock, and set your feet for the coming combat! ROLL A D20 TO ATTACK! (IF YOU CHOOSE, YOU MAY ROLL ANY INSPIRATION DICE AND ADD THEIR TOTALS TO YOUR ROLL IN ORDER TO SUCCEED) (set: $AshFiendsNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $AshFiendsNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|AshFiends Input]]You consider the strange and wonderful fruit, and though you are curious, you move on. These fields belong to another. Surely theft here of all places is unthinkable! As you turn from the tree you had been inspecting, you notice you too are being inspected. A creature, like in texture and shape to a plant, but having the form of a human, stares at you unblinkingly. Its body and limbs are supple green-gold stems, and it towers over you. Its motions are slow, deliberate, and graceful. It reaches beyond you to the fruit you had been holding, plucks it from the tree, and holds it out to you, with its oddly fluid motions. You try to address it but it seems unable to speak. You take the fruit from it, and as you do it reaches out its foliate limb to your arm and rests it there. It is a gesture of peace. Then it turns and moves off, drawing its attention to another tree. The taste of the fruit is the embrace of a brother after long absence, or the gentle shush of your beloved after waking in the night. As you consume it, your eyes and ears are awakened. You watch and hear the world you saw through Midgard's eyes take on its full glory. What were veins of embered gold and translucent fire from the ground are revealed. These are songs and stories made manifest - the beauty and joy of the worlds below filtered through the earth of Alftheim and rising to be caught in the great canopies overhead! As you run you hand through the undulant light, you can hear individual songs: Songs from the giants about the might of stone and ice. Songs of your people about the first days of spring. Gentle songs of mothers to calm the restless child. Songs at hearth and after battle. You feel each and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES! ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY (A D12) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL, TO USE IN AID OF A FUTURE TASK OF YOUR CHOOSING! THE HONOR YOU PAID THIS REALM BY CHOOSING NOT TO STEAL IS REPAID TO YOU! YOU MAY ADD A REROLL TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[DAY 10->DAY 10AS]]The taste of the fruit is the embrace of a brother after long absence, or the gentle shush of your beloved after waking in the night. As you consume it, your eyes and ears are awakened. You watch and hear the world you saw through Midgard's eyes now take on its full glory. What were veins of embered gold and translucent fire from the ground are revealed. These are songs and stories made manifest - the beauty and joy of the worlds below filtered through the earth of Alftheim and rising to be caught in the great canopies overhead! As you run you hand through the undulant light, you can hear individual songs: Songs from the giants about the might of stone and ice. Songs of your people about the first days of spring. Gentle songs of mothers to calm the restless child. Songs at hearth and after battle. You feel each and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY (A D12) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL, TO USE IN AID OF A FUTURE TASK OF YOUR CHOOSING! [[DAY 10->DAY 10AS]]<h2>SOUTH - Sunstone Plains</h2> You swing the tiller landward, and your ship heels to your turn. Soon you feel the gentle resistance of sanded shores on the keel of your ship. Before you, a wide flat land extends out to the edges of vision, like a desert in form, but utterly unlike it in experience. The ground is threaded with veins of luminous gold, that flicker and throb erratically. From them a light like translucent fire rises in a slow dance. The air is warm and gentle, and the wind whispers comforting secrets just beyond hearing. Not far away, trees like willows grow at intervals, brushing the ground gently with their branches. Above you, floating in the ceruluan sky, great wide canopies of gossamer thread spread wide. They filter the sun's light on the ground, making it dance like the shadows of water on the shallows of the seas of midgard, your home. Each great canopy is connected to the earth by a thicker cord of the same thread, that undulates gently in the singing breeze. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 9->Day 9AS]]You take up the cup, and pretend to drink, but let no wine pass your lips. This is still a strange land, and it would be best to proceed with healthy caution. PRUDENCE IS THE BETTER PART OF VALOR: YOU NEITHER GAIN NOR LOSE A DIE IN YOUR INSPIRATION POOL. [[DAY 10->DAY 10AWN]]You take the cup and bow to your host, then lift it to your lips. The taste of the wine on your tongue is the embrace of a brother after long absence, or the gentle shush of your beloved after waking in the night. As you consume it, your eyes and ears are awakened. You watch and hear the city you saw through Midgard's eyes take on its full glory. The cobbles of the road are the droning song of the laborer at work. The waters of the harbor are the harmonies of the sea and sky. The stones of the city are the songs and stories of marching armies. This city is made of the beauty and joy of the worlds below, hardened into stone and molded into brick and mortar! You can, by straining your ear, hear individual songs - the victory of the righteous here, the sorrow of the living for the honored dead. You feel each, and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY (A D12) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL, TO USE IN AID OF A FUTURE TASK OF YOUR CHOOSING! [[DAY 10->DAY 10AWY]]<h2>WEST - The Great Citadel</h2> You tack towards the great port, where crystalline vessels rest in the water like jewels in a crown. Your faithful ship seems oddly solid and coarse amidst the vessels of this realm. You secure your craft in the harbor, and make your way onto the boardwalk of the great city. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 9->Day 9AW]]<h2>THE WOLF</h2> "This is Ylgr, my she-wolf. She will show you the way to the Skaldsal, and aid you in undoing Sigyn's madness." Ylgr stalks from the halls behind you and sits, regarding you with knowing eyes. She is beautiful and terrible in her stillness, and the Eitr flows around her as an adornment of royalty. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 15->DAY 15AD]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> You dismiss your hunch, for Freyr speaks truly. Sigyn must have some secret purpose apart from his knowledge. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 15->DAY 15AS]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> "Come, God of Peace." You reply, "If I am to cure this blight I must know all, and I sense that something is withheld. For the sake of the Nine Realms, tell me everything!" A great weight seems to settle on Freyr, and his light dims as he speaks again: "I will tell you, but you must swear to speak of this to none beyond these walls, Maor." "I swear it on the life of Midgard and the heart of my beloved." You reply. He watches you, gaging your sincerity, then speaks again, "The gods erred when they bound Loki in his prison. His punishment was richly deserved, but our hearts were bent on revenge, not justice. We thought not of the shudders of suffering that proceed from the hammer blow of vengeance. Sigyn has borne endless grief at the side of her beloved for long centuries with no relief. We desired to forget our revenge, and her with it. The power of the Skaldsal is little understood. Sigyn, when she came hence, came in secret and proposed a plan to undo the injustice of her suffering. She thought that in Skaldsal she could undo the past, and remake it so that the vengeance of the gods was tempered and her grief could be alleviated. I was intrigued, for should she succeed, I could go to the Skaldsal and spread peace like a great wave flowing from Alfheim across all of history, by the righting of past wrongs! I let her go, bidding her return and tell me if she found success. She never did, and I assumed she had failed. But now I fear she has wrought some terrible evil, and am filled with fear!" [[CONTINUE->AshFiendsDMG]]<h2>DEFEAT!</h2> You've wounded the creatures greviously, but not mortally, and they know they have you now. They leer at you menacingly, and as they stab down at you with their needle claws, your vision narrows and fades to black. But you do not die, and even the desperation of drowning you should feel clears like mist at the dawn in merest moment. But no sun rise comes. Instead, you are spinning and falling endlessly down and down and down - the colors of the worlds mix and mingle as you tumble for what seems an eternity. And then you are not falling, you are sinking in a mire that pulls at your boots and clings to your skin like the touch of the dead. And all around you stretch the endless windswept wastelands. You rise, and while the fearsome wounds from your combat are still present, they are as far-away reminders of a fading nightmare. The blood that should be coursing from them is frozen in time, like a winter stream. What is this place? (link: "Continue")The mud near you coalesces like fingers grasping at the air, growing and congealing towards the shape of a body. The runnels of muck resolve into features, first vague, then clear and alive. Then an arm reaches out from it, becoming a tendril, that wraps with the inevitability of a snake's coils around your neck. A face emerges and turns to you - the face of a goddess: beautiful and hollow and terrible. A voice like a final whisper permeates your mind, "Who are you, and what business have you in the realm of the dead?" (link: "Continue")[ Before you can catch your breath, the rubble and glass all around take on life, rising and twisting into a singular, colossal form. The elements resolve into features, first vague, then clear and terrible. An arm of fire and rock extends from the mass, its fingers becoming a tendril of black flame that coils around your neck with the inevitability of a snake. ADD THE D6 YOU JUST ROLLED TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[DAY 3]]You begin your ascent of the city, through twisting streets of narrow high walls, and open courtyards framed by great arches. The lines of the city are fluid, and curved. Unlike the buildings of Midgard, full of squared timbers and straight lines, these curve and flow, so the beginning of one building and the end of another can hardly be found at a glance. As to the city's denizens, you are attracting much attention. Conversation fades to curious whispers as you approach, and in your wake it grows back again, louder than before. None approach, until you turn down a road that eventually ends in high walls. There is no way out, and as you turn to retrace your steps, you are greeted by three tall figures who block the returning path and leer at you with smiles that stretch too wide across their gilded faces. Where most of the light elves have even-toned skin, the faces of your accosters are mottled and cracked and brittle. You put your hand to your (print:$weapon), every muscle tense in readiness. "Welcome to Ljos, Maor." The foremost of them says, with a wicked snigger, "I'm sure you have a story you'd like to share." "I have not time for this! My errand is with the Songcourt!" You reply. "The Songcourt! Well, far be it from us to interrupt your purposes. But you wouldn't deprive us of a song would you? It is only polite to share, as a guest..." He holds out a crystalline hand, interwoven with a thin band of Gold. It has a luminous, shifting glow. You draw back. "So reluctant?" says the leader, "No matter. You can give us what we want by your hand, or by ours." And with that, he lunges for you! You have only a split second to bring your shield to bear, and swing your (print:$weapon) up! You stumble away and regroup, but even as you do you realize with horror that the touch of the luminous hand did not just bring pain - it has taken memories! Where once the name and face of your father and mother sat in a place of honor in your mind, there is only a maddening absence! [[CONTINUE->BrigandsDMG]]<h2>DEFEAT!</h2> You've driven your attackers back, for the moment, but only at the cost of grevious wounds to your body and mind. The Light Elves smile with manic eyes, knowing they have you now. Cackling gleefully they drive you to the ground, and jam their crystalline artifacts into your body. You scream in pain and horror as memories fade to grey like mist, and your vision narrows to black. But you do not die, and even the deep and visceral pain you should feel clears like mist at the dawn in merest moment. But no sun rise comes. Instead, you are spinning and falling endlessly down and down and down - the colors of the worlds mix and mingle as you tumble for what seems an eternity. And then you are not falling, you are sinking in a mire that pulls at your boots and clings to your skin like the touch of the dead. And all around you stretch the endless windswept wastelands. You rise, and while the fearsome wounds from your combat are still present, they are as far-away reminders of a fading nightmare. The blood that should be coursing from them is frozen in time, like a winter stream. What is this place? The runnels of muck resolve into features, first vague, then clear and alive. Then an arm reaches out from it, becoming a tendril, that wraps with the inevitability of a snake's coils around your neck. A face emerges and turns to you - the face of a goddess: beautiful and hollow and terrible. A voice like a final whisper permeates your mind, "Who are you, and what business have you in the realm of the dead?" [[[[CONTINUE->HEL1]]]] ]<h2>HIT!</h2> Your aim is true! His face cracks, and he stumbles back, light leaking from the wound like the waters of a moonlit brook. He screams at you, not in the musical lilt you have so far heard from the Ljosalfar, but in a dark, sharp tongue, that rips the air like claws in flesh. [[Continue|BrigandsDMG]]<h2>VICTORY!</h2> You time your final dodge, and redirect the momentum of your attackers into each other! Instead of making contact with you, the artifacts they wield make contact with each other. They scream in unearthly pain! Their brittle skin begins to leak light, as if the magical draw these devices inflict is utter agony for them! In the moment of your advantage, you slam your shoulder into your stunned attackers, sending them to the ground in a chaotic mass of struggling limbs. You slam your weapon into the chest of one, then the other, and shout in your rage, "BEGONE THIEVES AND PARASITES, OR I WILL SATE THE HUNGER OF MY BLADE WITH YOUR LIVES! There is a moment of silence, then those who can scramble for the mouth of the alley and flee, streaming light-blood from their wounds. Those too wounded lie where they have fallen. You draw a shaky breath. The battle is over. You've won! (link: "Continue")[ No sooner has the dust settled from the strife, then a troop of Light Elf warriors appear at the mouth of the alley. Their armor is pearlescent white, and they all carry fearsome pole-axes. The axe-heads are wrought into beautiful curves of terrible keenness. "Who are you, and why do you trouble this city? Speak quickly, for the slaying of a citizen of Ljos is a capital crime." You stand and call out, "I come by the will of Odin and His Beloved, with a purpose greater than any man or elf. I did not seek to kill the ones you see slain here. They came upon me with crystalline handes that stole the memories from my mind. I should as well ask you why the Light-elves offer such hospitality to guests of their city. Or has the realm of peace forgotten its namesake?" The assembled soldiers shift in anger at your words. "I require an audience with the Songcourt!" You continue, "You would do well to aid me or leave me be!" One soldier steps forward and regards you narrowly. "You make a brazen request for one found in the commission of a crime, Maor. What possible reason or authority would compel me to bring you to the highest court in the land?" [[CONTINUE->ALF2]] ](set: _inputNum to (num: $CBLEED)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 90)[ (go-to: "CBLEEDPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 90)[ (go-to: "CBLEEDFAIL") ] [[CBLEEDPASS]] [[CBLEEDFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die7]]<h2>DEFEAT!!</h2> You and your comrades at let the Eitr flow from your veins and onto the golden leaves, and for a time the colors mix and mingle and you feel hope in your heart. But soon it comes to pass that the pull from the tree finds no more Eitr to draw forth from you. It begins to pull your very life away and you feel the cold tingling numb of death creeping from your hand, up your arm, to your fast-beating heart. You crumble to your knees, but still the invisible force holds you, and now the swirl of blackness mixes with the swirl of light at your feet. Jormungandrs poison reaches your fingers, then your hands, then your arm, leeching your strength and curling your body into serpentine agony. All is pain. A high uncanny laugh echoes through all creation: of a madwoman now avenged on all things and the author of every end. Beneath your feet, you see the golden leaves of Ygdrassil's crown wither and turn to ash. Then beneath, the blackened branches of Ygrassil are consumed as if the turn of time has been shot from a bow. Up and up the blackness travels, to the crown where you stand. A rending groan runs through the World Tree. Points of burning light, brighter than a thousand suns, begin to run along a million veins in its withered bark, that widen and strain. You can see them. The branches holding the Nine Worlds sag and slide and begin to dissipate like burning ash thrown up by the wind. A mighty crash, and the sound of every voice of every being that was or is or will be calls out in fear, and is no more. The tree splits through it's mighty trunk from it's tips to the base of every root. All falls. All burns. All is ended. All is dark. All but Odin's arm, which leans through all and catches the arrow of time, pulling it back again to the bow. Undoing become renewing and all is reversed, and you find yourself back in your bed, Odin's voice in your ear: “Come, sons and daughters. Gather to me, for I have plans and purposes for you. Come, rise and make ready before the dawning sun…” BEGIN THE STORY AGAIN! PERHAPS THIS TIME THE DICE WILL FAVOR YOU! [[DAY 1]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You and your comrades let the Eitr flow from your veins and into the Crown of the World Tree. The glow brightens and you see the mingled colors of the worlds flow outward and downward, into the limbs of Ygdrassil. Suddenly instead of the rippled bark, there is a panoply of light and color, and the great reach of the entire sky appears behind the maze-dance of the branchs' patterns. The mighty limbs span impossible distance, holding aloft the Nine Realms, and where the blackness has crept insidiously down the branches, it is now forced back - burned and consumed by the life-giving Eitr every realm! The tree springs to life in a blinding flash of vibrancy and Odin's bellowing laugh breaks forth and suffuses all. The very stars themselves dance with the joy of new spring dawn! But your joy is interrupted by a swift and venomous pain in your outstretched hand. In your midst, a Goddess of the Vanir has appeared. She is beautiful and terrible beyond reckoning, and her wrath radiates from her in suffocating waves of heat and light. "NO!" She screams, "You will not take my vengeance from me!" With the speed of lightning she reaches and grasps the throats of the assembled warriors with hands that emerge from nowhere. "You ants and worms of Midgard dare to cross my will? I who have suffered twice for the transgression of my beloved? I will bind you with the entrails of your children, and bleed the snakes venom into your eyes myself, until all you are is pain and bitterness!" You feel your feet leave the floor and the air being choked from you lungs. Your vision darkens at the edges, and in place of the starred heavens, you see the cave under Jotunheim's earth, where Loki has suffered since the murder of Baldur. You blink, and you are there. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 23->DAY 23]]After a time you become drowsy. The silence of this place is profound, but for the low whistle of the wind through the fissure high above. It is only because of this that the small falling of pebbles awakens you from your half-sleep. You eyes blink open, and you look around. Five great hounds have gathered around you on silent paws. Their teeth are bared, and along their spines a line of embers burns, From beneath their bodies, flames lick up their sides with no apparent burning. They are coal black. The closest of them snarls as your scramble to your feet, and leaps at you with bared fangs, out of which smoke pours! You have only a split second to bring your shield to bear, and swing your (print:$weapon) up! ROLL A D20 TO ATTACK! You move as quickly as you dare, and enter the roiling maelstrom at Hvergelmir's center. On reaching the eye of the maelstrom, you are surprised to find the waters here calm and still. More astonishing still, you see floating at their center a great black fang that leeches black poison into the waters! You float forward and touch it, but it burns with caustic fire! ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17N]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D16NFNumber1)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4N") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 14)[ (go-to: "D16NFPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 14)[ (go-to: "D16NFFAIL") ] [[D16NFPASS]] [[D16NFFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4N]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> Your (print:$amulet) glows, and the waters of Hvergelmir begin to slow. But just as you dare to step out upon them, the glow of your amulet flickers and dies, and the coalesced waters of the Great Well disperse into chaos once again! You are tossed and turned until there is no sky or waters. You kick out, hoping to overcome the currents by strength and so find the surface, but you cannot! Your lungs burn, and you are pulled under, into the depths of Hvergelmir. With your last breath you hear a high uncanny laugh that echoes through all creation: of a madwoman now avenged on all things and the author of every end. Above in the arching sky you see the blackened branches of Ygrassil consumed as if the turn of time has been shot from a bow. Up and up the blackness travels, to the crown where Asgard rests. A rending groan runs through the World Tree, and the branches sag. Points of burning light, brighter than a thousand suns, begin to run along a million veins in its withered bark, that widen and strain. You can see them. The branches holding the Nine Worlds sag and slide and begin to dissipate like burning ash thrown up by the wind. A mighty crash, and the sound of every voice of every being that was or is or will be calls out in fear, and is no more. The tree splits through it's mighty trunk from it's tips to the base of every root. All falls. All burns. All is ended. All is dark. All but Odin's arm, which leans through all and catches the arrow of time, pulling it back again to the bow. Undoing become renewing and all is reversed, and you find yourself back in your bed, Odin's voice in your ear: “Come, sons and daughters. Gather to me, for I have plans and purposes for you. Come, rise and make ready before the dawning sun…” BEGIN THE STORY AGAIN! PERHAPS THIS TIME THE DICE WILL FAVOR YOU!" [[DAY 1]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> Your (print:$amulet) glows in response, and the waters of Hvergelmir slow and coalesce! You step out on them, and they hold beneath your feet, though they shift and move with the slickness of living ice. You move as quickly as you dare across the roiling maelstrom at Hvergelmir's center. On reaching the center, you are surprised to find the waters here calm and still. More astonishing still, you see floating at their center a great black fang that leeches black poison into the waters! You float forward and touch it, but it burns with caustic fire! ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17N]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D16NSNumber1)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4N") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 12)[ (go-to: "D16NSPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 12)[ (go-to: "D16NSFAIL") ] [[D16NSPASS]] [[D16NSFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4N]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> You run and cast yourself into the waters! Immediately you are tossed and turned until there is no sky or water. You kick out, hoping to overcome the currents by strength and so find the surface, but you cannot! Your lungs burn, and you are pulled under, into the depths of Hvergelmir. With your last breath you hear a high uncanny laugh echoes through all creation: of a madwoman now avenged on all things and the author of every end. Above in the arching sky you see the blackened branches of Ygrassil consumed as if the turn of time has been shot from a bow. Up and up the blackness travels, to the crown where Asgard rests. A rending groan runs through the World Tree, and the branches sag. Points of burning light, brighter than a thousand suns, begin to run along a million veins in its withered bark, that widen and strain. You can see them. The branches holding the Nine Worlds sag and slide and begin to dissipate like burning ash thrown up by the wind. A mighty crash, and the sound of every voice of every being that was or is or will be calls out in fear, and is no more. The tree splits through it's mighty trunk from it's tips to the base of every root. All falls. All burns. All is ended. All is dark. All but Odin's arm, which leans through all and catches the arrow of time, pulling it back again to the bow. Undoing become renewing and all is reversed, and you find yourself back in your bed, Odin's voice in your ear: “Come, sons and daughters. Gather to me, for I have plans and purposes for you. Come, rise and make ready before the dawning sun…” BEGIN THE STORY AGAIN! PERHAPS THIS TIME THE DICE WILL FAVOR YOU!" [[DAY 1]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> It takes all your power to fight against the pull of the mighty waters, and make your way to the center of the well. But through long desperate labor, you pull yourself through the current stroke by stroke! On reaching the center, you are surprised to find the waters here calm and still. More astonishing still, you see floating at their center a great black fang that leeches black poison into the waters! You float forward and touch it, but it burns with caustic fire! ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17N]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D16SNumber1)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4S") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 7)[ (go-to: "D16SPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 7)[ (go-to: "D16SFAIL") ] [[D16SPASS]] [[D16SFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4S]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> You pour all of your willpower into the Eitr being drawn from your hands, and feel your body begin to pass through the obsidian glass. But by and by your will fades, and no matter your pressing and straining you cannot will yourself further! You begin to panic and struggle - you cannot extract your hands! (print:$animal) senses your distress and comes to rest alongside you, pouring the Eitr from herself into you, and so into the floor. You feel your body passing through the glass inverted! You look downwards, and see (print:$animal) watching your reflection. The Eitr that has, until now, run freely down and around her is slowed and stiffened. Much of her power has been sapped. LOSE A DICE OF YOUR CHOICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17S]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You pour all of your will into the Eitr being drawn from your hands, and feel your body passing through the glass, inverted! You look downwards, and see (print:$animal) on the other side tapping curiously on the glassy floor at your reflection... ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17S]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D16VNumber1)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4V") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 7)[ (go-to: "D16VPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 7)[ (go-to: "D16VFAIL") ] [[D16VPASS]] [[D16VFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4V]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> (print: $animal) watches you struggle and fail in the face of the poison cloud. She steps to your side and allows you to touch her flank. In doing the Eitr flows from her into you, and the power of the poison could loses its strength. You pass through to the fang, but your companion has given much of her strength already to aid you. You may not be able to look to her aid in the future... LOSE A DICE OF YOUR CHOICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17V]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You summon the strength of the Eitr within, and force your way through the noxious fumes to the vile fang protruding from the Heartwood. It is too large for human hands, but you must try. ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 17->DAY 17V]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D17ANumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4aA") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 15)[ (go-to: "D17APASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 15)[ (go-to: "I've Run Out Of InspirationA!") [[I've Run Out Of Inspiration!]] [[D17HPASS]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4a]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D17JNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4aJ") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 15)[ (go-to: "D17JPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 15)[ (go-to: "I've Run Out Of Inspiration!J") [[D17JPASS]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4aJ]] [[I've Run Out Of Inspiration!J]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D17MFNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4aMF") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 15)[ (go-to: "D17MFPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 15)[ (go-to: "I've Run Out Of Inspiration!") [[I've Run Out Of Inspiration!M]] [[D17MPPASS]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4aMP]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D17VNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4aV") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 15)[ (go-to: "D17VPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 15)[ (go-to: "I've Run Out Of Inspiration!") [[I've Run Out Of Inspiration!N]] [[D17NPASS]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4aN]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D17SNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4aS") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 15)[ (go-to: "D17SPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 15)[ (go-to: "I've Run Out Of InspirationA!") [[I've Run Out Of Inspiration!S]] [[D17SPASS]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4aS]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D17VNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die4aV") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 15)[ (go-to: "D17VPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 15)[ (go-to: "I've Run Out Of Inspiration!V") [[I've Run Out Of Inspiration!V]] [[D17VPASS]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die4aV]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> As you sing, a shape coalesces in the floor of the hall, dark against the brilliant golds and silvers. Your voice traces the melody and catches the skittering discord, and the shape coalesces into a black burning fang, driven into the floor of the Skaldsal. You pull it from the floor, and immediately it shrivels and burns to the size of your hand. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY TO YOUR POOL! You turn your ear to the Eternal Song, expecting that perhaps this has healed the wound. But it is not to be. The spread of the discord has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged. You must return to Freyr and the Songcourt, to better understand... [[CONTINUE TO DAY 18->DAY 18A]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> With a great groan the fang is pulled from the Weeping Stone and lands with finality on the ground. Immediately it shrivels and burns to the size of your hand. You pick it up. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! You turn to the Weeping Stone, expecting that perhaps this has healed the wound. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr to and from Helheim is clouded. You must return to Hel, to better understand. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 18->DAY 18H]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> With a great groan the fang is pulled from Mimir's Well and lands with finality on the ground. Immediately it shrivels and burns to the size of your hand. You pick it up. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! You turn to Mimir's Well, expecting that perhaps this has healed the wound. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr to and from Jotunheim is clouded. How you are to undo this, you know not. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 18->DAY 18J]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> Finally, the smooth face of the transparent crystal shatters, showering you in fragments. Whatever enchantment held it suspended above the chasm is broken, and everything plummets towards the depths! By pure instinct you reach out with your free hand as you fall and catch the great fang in your grip, you teeter on the brink of the coalesced Eitr you stood upon, staring down into the depths of Ginnungagap! You teeter, but by Odin's providence and good balance, you do not fall! You collect yourself with a few breaths, and return to the chasm's edge, thanking Frigga for the mercy of firm ground beneath your feet once more! You put out a hand and rest it on (print:$animal)'s flank, in silent gratitude to her for saving your life again. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY TO YOUR POOL! Once you have recovered, you look again at the Eitr's flow, expecting that perhaps this has lifted the blight. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr into Ygdrassil is clouded. Surt might know more of this fang and how the poison might be cured, but you know not whether he is to be trusted. [[RETURN TO SURT->MRETURN]] OR [[FIND YOUR OWN WAY BACK->MFLEE]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> Finally, the smooth face of the transparent crystal shatters, showering you in fragments. Whatever enchantment held it suspended above the chasm is broken, and everything plummets towards the depths! By pure instinct you reach out with your free hand as you fall and catch the great fang in your grip, but it is all for naught. Hope dies in your breast as you watch the chasm's edge disappear above you! But (print:$animal) has seen your plight. She lets out a thunderous call, and the Eitr that flows from her and coalesces beneath you, arresting your fall, and raising you up to the chasm lip. You collapse on the hard dry ground and breathe heavily, thanking Frigga for the mercy of firm ground beneath your feet once more! You put out a hand and rest it on (print:$animal)'s flank, in silent gratitude for saving your life once more. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY TO YOUR POOL! Once you have recovered, you look again at the Eitr's flow, expecting that perhaps this has lifted the blight. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr into Ygdrassil is clouded. Surt might know more of this fang and how the poison might be cured, but you know not whether he is to be trusted. [[RETURN TO SURT->MRETURN]] OR [[FIND YOUR OWN WAY BACK->MFLEE]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You pour your strength into moving the great fang, and though it burns you, you hold! And just as you are convinced you can hold no longer, the power of the magic that holds it in the waters breaks, and the blackness runs off you and into the waves around! YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! You look again at the Eitr's flow, expecting that perhaps this has lifted the blight. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr into Ygdrassil is clouded. Nott would be able to bring the light of knowledge to this, but time is short, and the way back to her is long! On the other hand, Hvergelmir is the source of every river in all creation, including the Bifrost itself! Choosing to put yourself at the mercy of its currents is a risky venture, but one that would save you many days travel! Will you Return to Nott for more information, and solicit her aid again, sacrificing time? (Less risk, but you will lose a dice from your dice pool!) OR Would you dive into Hvergelmir, and risk the chaos waters of the Bifrost with no ship to carry you? (A Difficult check, but Gain a reroll on some subsequent roll if you succeed!) [[RETURN TO NOTT->NRETURN]] OR [[RISK THE TREACHEROUS WATERS OF HVELGEMIR->NFLEE]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> With a great groaning hiss the fang withdraws from the root! Immediately it shrivels and burns to the size of your hand. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY TO YOUR POOL! You turn to the flow of the Eitr to Ygdrassil's root, expecting that perhaps this has healed the wound. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr to and from Svartaflheim is clouded. How you are to undo this, you know not. Perhaps Mostognir could shed some light on the nature of the fang and its venom... [[CONTINUE TO DAY 18->DAY 18S]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> With a great groan the fang is pulled from the Heartwood and lands with finality on the ground. Immediately it shrivels and burns to the size of your hand. You pick it up. YOU HAVE THE GREAT FANG. ADD THE DICE FROM TODAY TO YOUR POOL! You turn to the Heartwood, expecting that perhaps this has healed the wound. But it is not to be. The spread of the dark has been stayed, but its extent remains unchanged, and still the flow of Eitr to and from Vanaheim is clouded. You must return to Njord, to better understand. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 18->DAY 18V]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D18HNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 4)[ (go-to: "D18HPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 4)[ (go-to: "D18HFAIL") ] [[D18HPASS]] [[D18HFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die5]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D18ANumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5A") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 4)[ (go-to: "D18APASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 4)[ (go-to: "D18AFAIL") ] [[D18APASS]] [[D18AFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die5A]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> Too late you see the pattern of the waves. You try and heel to meet the coming tide, but it catches you broadside, and the ship founders and turns, her mast-head dipping unnaturally into the swiling waters. You are thrown into the sea, and emerge moments later, the flotsam and jetsam of your ship floating nearby. As the currents of the Bifrost swirl and pull you in, you cling to some floating wreckage, holding on thin hope that the Bifrost currents will send you to Asgard's shores by mere chance. In the sky above, the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19F]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You see the moving of the waves and turn the tiller hard to meet them with the prow of your ship. She cuts through the waves time and again, kicking and shuddering as you fight to reach the rift to the Bifrost. Finally, your cross over, and feel the force of currents grab your ship like a plaything and throw you into the rainbow flow of the Bifrost. You set your course for the shining lights of Asgard, as the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies." ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D10) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19S]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> Too late you see the pattern of the waves. You try and heel to meet the coming tide, but it catches you broadside. The ship founders and yaws, her mast-head dipping unnaturally into the swiling waters. You are thrown into the raging currents! Chaos reigns, and you have no sense of up or down. By purest luck your head breaks the surface moments later, the flotsam and jetsam of your ship floating nearby. As the currents of the Bifrost swirl and pull you in, you cling to some floating wreckage, holding on thin hope that the Bifrost currents will send you to Asgard's shores by mere chance. In the sky above, the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies. You set your course for the shining lights of Asgard, as the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19S]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D18NNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5N") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 5)[ (go-to: "D18NPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 5)[ (go-to: "D18NFAIL") ] [[D18NPASS]] [[D18NFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die5N]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D18N3Number)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5N3") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 10)[ (go-to: "D18N3PASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 10)[ (go-to: "D18N3FAIL") ] [[D18N3PASS]] [[D18N3FAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die5N3]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> You pick a direction and kick towards it, hoping it is the sky, and not the depths. You are wrong. Your lungs burn, and you feel the currents bowl you over, and sweep you around, until you can hold them off no longer! With your last breath the waters rush into your chest, and as you drown you hear a high uncanny laugh echoes through all creation: of a madwoman now avenged on all things, and the author of every end. Above in the arching sky you see the blackened branches of Ygrassil consumed as if the turn of time has been shot from a bow. Up and up the blackness travels, to the crown where Asgard rests. A rending groan runs through the World Tree, and the branches sag. Points of burning light, brighter than a thousand suns, begin to run along a million veins in its withered bark, that widen and strain. You can see them. The limbs that hold the Nine Worlds sag and slide and begin to dissipate like burning ash thrown up by the wind. A mighty crash, and the sound of every voice of every being that was or is or will be calls out in fear, and is no more. The tree splits through it's mighty trunk from it's tips to the base of every root. All falls. All burns. All is ended. All is dark. All but Odin's arm, which leans through all and catches the arrow of time, pulling it back again to the bow. Undoing become renewing and all is reversed, and you find yourself back in your bed, Odin's voice in your ear: “Come, sons and daughters. Gather to me, for I have plans and purposes for you. Come, rise and make ready before the dawning sun…” BEGIN THE STORY AGAIN! PERHAPS THIS TIME THE DICE WILL FAVOR YOU!"<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You sense of direction does not abandon you, even in this desperate hour. You kick upwards toward the sky, and break the surface with a great gasp! You reach out and grasp a piece of flotsam, clinging to it to keep yourself alfoat, hoping against hope that you are drawn by providence into the tributary that leads upward to Asgard! ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D10) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! FOR SUCCESSFULLY SWIMMING THE WATERS OF HVERGELMIR, YOU ALSO GAIN A REROLL ON ANY DIE ROLL! (MARK IT ON YOUR JOURNAL!) [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19F]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> Too late you see the pattern of the waves. You try and heel to meet the coming tide, but it catches you broadside, and the ship founders and turns, her mast-head dipping unnaturally into the swiling waters. You are thrown into the sea, and emerge moments later, the flotsam and jetsam of your ship floating nearby. As the currents of the Bifrost swirl and pull you in, you cling to some floating wreckage, holding on thin hope that the Bifrost currents will send you to Asgard's shores by mere chance. In the sky above, the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19F]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You see the moving of the waves and turn the tiller hard to meet them with the prow of your ship. She cuts through the waves time and again, kicking and shuddering as you fight to reach the rift to the Bifrost. Finally, your cross over, and feel the force of currents grab your ship like a plaything and throw you into the rainbow flow of the Bifrost. You set your course for the shining lights of Asgard, as the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies." ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D10) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19S]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D18SNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5S") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 4)[ (go-to: "D18SPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 4)[ (go-to: "D18SFAIL") ] [[D18SPASS]] [[D18SFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die5S]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> Too late you see the pattern of the waves. You try and heel to meet the coming tide, but it catches you broadside, and the ship founders and turns, her mast-head dipping unnaturally into the swiling waters. You are thrown into the sea, and emerge moments later, the flotsam and jetsam of your ship floating nearby. As the currents of the Bifrost swirl and pull you in, you cling to some floating wreckage, holding on thin hope that the Bifrost currents will send you to Asgard's shores by mere chance. In the sky above, the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies. You set your course for the shining lights of Asgard, as the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies." [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19S]](set: _inputNum to (num: $D18VNumber)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die5V") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 4)[ (go-to: "D18VPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 4)[ (go-to: "D18VFAIL") ] [[D18VPASS]] [[D18VFAIL]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die5V]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> Too late you see the pattern of the waves. You try and heel to meet the coming tide, but it catches you broadside, and the ship founders and turns, her mast-head dipping unnaturally into the swilling waters. You are thrown into the sea, and emerge moments later, the flotsam and jetsam of your ship floating nearby. As the currents of the Bifrost swirl and pull you in, you cling to some floating wreckage, holding on thin hope that the Bifrost currents will send you to Asgard's shores by mere chance. In the sky above, the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies. [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19F]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You see the moving of the waves and turn the tiller hard to meet them with the prow of your ship. She cuts through the waves time and again, kicking and shuddering as you fight to reach the rift to the Bifrost.
