You set your course for the shining lights of Asgard, as the blackness of Jormungandr's poison curls up the vast limbs of Ygdrassil that dominate the skies." ADD THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D10) TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 19->DAY 19S]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 1</h1> You awaken from your slumberings, the grit of sleep still in your eyes. The hour is early, and the sun has many hours yet before it climbs to the horizon. Shaking your head, you rise and feel the cold stone of your hearth beneath your feet. A few fitful embers linger in the hearth to greet you. But theirs is not the only greeting… “It was not a dream, child.” The words of Frigga, beloved of Odin, ring in your mind with all the force of the hammer’s blow. “I have need of a warrior's hands. There is a blight upon the World Tree. Her roots twist and shrink, and the branches blacken and fade. My husband's life is bound to the world tree, and as it fades so does he. His arm can no longer bring Gungnir* to flight, and the light by which he holds the Bifrost flickers against his will. This has not happened in my knowing, and I fear that it means the coming of Ragnarok before its appointed time. And so it falls to the faithful of Midgard, of which you are one, warrior. From eight of the Nine Realms the blight spreads. You will be one of many sent to seek it to its source and leech it out.” WILL YOU HEED THE CALL? [[DAY 2]] OR [[Go Back To Bed...]] //Gungnir - Odin's mighty spear// //The Bifrost - The great rainbow river that connects the Nine Realms of norse mythology.// //Midgard - The realm where humans dwell.//<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You sail on through the laughing waters, that gently push and buffet your ship. It is just as night falls, and an impossibly large silver moon turns the seas to a brilliant expanse of winking glittering light, that there is a shadow and a ripple amidst the waves. You watch again - certain it is a trick of the playful surf, but then it is there again. And then again. You trim the sails and tie off the rudder, leaving your hands free. In an eye's blink, the surface breaks... [[CONTINUE->SEASERPENT]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue into the forest in hushed awe. Every tread reveals new wonders: flora and fauna unseen by the eye of man, all glowing with lights as numerous as they are variegated. By and by, you come to a silvered pool, over which hover a group of shining orbs. They dip timidly at the water's surface, then rise, before again dipping, in a strange dance. You approach silently and watch. By and by the orbs cease their dance and begin a slow migration towards you. You rise and retreat, but their movements mirror yours. You stumble back more quickly, but they again follow, matching your height and closing the ground beneath you. You begin to run but even as you do you see the light get brighter on the ground beneath your feet, and the shadows sharper, as the glowing orbs approach. Realizing escape is impossible, you turn to confront them! [[CONTINUE->WISP]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You press onward, between the even spaced rows of great willows and gossamer tethered nets above. By and by, you see a herd of utterly alien creatures. They resemble a deer in body, but their short legs splay out widely, and their skin is a leathery gold. Their necks and heads extend absurdly upwards from their torsos into the limbs of the willowy trees. You approach slowly, wary, but curious at these fantastical creatures. As you get closer you see that they are reaching long tongues over the fruits of the trees, not to eat them, but to eat luminous insects that cling to the fruit and buzz quietly in the air around you. [[CONTINUE->LIGHTDEER]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You enquire as to the name of this great city, and of its inhabitants. "You have come to the great city of Ljos, city of the Ljosalfar - the Light Elves." Your guide is curious at your coming, and you make no secret of your errand. She is surprised, but remains serene. "If you speak truth, you must hasten to the Songcourt. Follow the road to the highest point. Be wary - not all who dwell here are peaceable or well-disposed to your kind. You are unique in our world, and some will see you as a wellspring of novelty to be drained dry for their own purposes." "A wellspring? I do not understand. What novelty would some here seek from me?" You reply. She looks at you incredulously "Of the life-blood of our realm, of course - of memory and song and story! Can you not see the Eitr?" You are disturbed. Your sight reveals no such thing, and you say as much. "Drink again of the wine, Maor. It is our gift as host to all who come, that they should see our land as we do." She offers the wine to you again. This time you drink. The taste of the wine on your tongue is the embrace of a brother after long absence, or the gentle shush of your beloved after waking in the night. As you consume it, your eyes and ears are awakened. You watch and hear the city you saw through Midgard's eyes take on its full glory. The cobbles of the road are the droning song of the laborer at work. The waters of the harbor are the harmonies of the sea and sky. The stones of the city are the songs and stories of marching armies. This city is made of the beauty and joy of the worlds below, hardened into stone and molded into brick and mortar! You can, by straining your ear, hear individual songs - the victory of the righteous here, the sorrow of the living for the honored dead. You feel each, and all at once, and are nearly overwhelmed by the wealth of emotions! THE EITR OF ALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES, AND YOU SEE AS THE LIGHT ELVES DO! Your host wishes you well, and you depart from her with thanks, making your way into the streets. [[CONTINUE->BRIGANDS]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You enquire as to the name of this great city, and of its inhabitants. "You have come to the great city of Ljos, city of the Ljosalfar - the Light Elves." Your guide is curious at your coming, and you make no secret of your errand. She is surprised, but remains serene. "If you speak truth, you must hasten to the Songcourt. Follow the road to the highest point. Be wary - not all who dwell here are peaceable or well-disposed to your kind. You are unique in our world, and some will see you as a wellspring of novelty to be drained dry for their own purposes." You depart from her with thanks, and make your way into the streets. [[CONTINUE->BRIGANDS]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You sail on through the strange waters for uncountable hours. No land catches your eye, though you constantly watch the horizon. In time, your vision blurs and shadows start to dance in the corners of your vision - islands that disappear the moment you turn your head to regard them. Clouds that become gaping mouths, then are once again clouds in the roiling sky. [[CONTINUE->Gjallarormr]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> By and by your wanderings along the pitted and cragged coastline bring you to a tide-bound cave. The waters ebb and flow from the inlet like the slow breath of a waiting leviathan. Making your way carefully along the water's edge, you peer into the cave. All is still, save the sound of the surf, and the drip of water from the cave walls. You make your way carefully into the cave. [[CONTINUE->GARMR]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue carefully through the woods, all senses attuned to danger. With this caution, you hear your foe before you see them, but not quickly enough to escape being noticed yourself. From the shaded woods, the forms of men emerge and shamble towards you, weapons in their hands. They have neither faces nor armor, but the darkness clings to them like mud. [[CONTINUE->Draugr]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue on, struggling and hacking through dense-woven thorny brush. You struggle on for hours, until you reach a great willow, whose boughs stretch wide. The bark is black, and the leaves are more flakes of ash than foliage. [[CONTINUE->Hrasevelgr]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You sail on through the strange waters for the better part of the sun's course through the sky. No land catches your eye, though you constantly watch the horizon. In time, your vision blurs and shadows start to dance in the corners of your vision - islands that disappear the moment you turn your head to regard them. Clouds that become gaping mouths, then are once again clouds in the roiling sky. [[CONTINUE->Skelkr]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You follow the winding path of this river inland, and by and by it widens out to a lake, formed in a valley between two bluffs. The waters are clear and deep. Making your way carefully along the water's edge, you peer into the still depths. You pick up a handful of gravel and throw it in. [[CONTINUE->KALDSAL]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue carefully through the skeletal plains, and they soon give way to the streets and alleyways of a great city. The outskirts are abandoned, but as you travel onwards you see run-down hovels inhabited by ragged families of giants. They stare at you suspiciously as you pass. Hostility hangs over you like a cloud, and by instinct you begin keeping to the shadows and avoiding the eyes of the city's denizens. But, you do not avoid every eye... You eventually emerge into a courtyard where several roads intersect.- it is comparatively small for this place as you have seen it thus far, but massive by the measures of Midgard. All this registers only as background to you, though, for from each road and between each building emerge armed giants, who stare you down balefully. The biggest steps to the center and speaks her challenge: "You've stepped down a wrong road, manling. None of your kind get to walk our streets alone. But, your loss is my gain - throw down your weapons and I will take you as slave, instead of killing you." [[CONTINUE->FrostGiants]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You find yourself struggling endlessly through narrow valleys of rubble, beneath grim windblown hills of bare rock. You stumble on for hours until you chance upon a wider, open hollow. At the center of the hollow, a great menhir juts skyward. Night has fallen. A strange moon rises above the hills, bathing all in an eerie blue-white. You sit and rest your back against the cold stone, weariness pressing you down like a great weight. [[CONTINUE->Gjárúg]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You sail on through the strange fires, and eventually the oil rain abates. No land yet catches your eye, though you constantly watch the horizon, wich wavers and shifts in the heat. In time, your vision blurs and shadows start to dance in the corners of your eyes - mountaions rising from the sea that disappear the moment you turn your head to regard them. Dark clouds that become gaping mouths, then are once again clouds in the roiling sky. [[CONTINUE->MAGMADRAKE]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> By and by the storm dissipates, and you make your way to the base of the mighty mountain, whose ridgeline extends, knifelike towards the ashen skies. You come upon a great valley of pitted volcanic rubble, and shards of obsidian. You scrabble down the slope the the valley floor, sending rocks sliding down the surface beneath you. Their falling echoes around the barren valley. In response, you hear a rumbling crash, and feel a low shudder in the earth... [[CONTINUE->GOLEM]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue carefully along the river, all senses attuned. You hear the danger before you see it, but not quickly enough to escape being noticed yourself... [[CONTINUE->ASHFIENDS]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You struggle onwards, and where the narrow parts of the fissure used to be rare, they are now common. The light filtering down from the mouth of the fissure high above is often obscured, and in the gathering gloom a claustrophobic fear grips your heart. It is a relief, then, when you stumble out into a wide chamber. The light is a little brighter here, and it is refracted through walls of white quartz that have grown at unearthly angles everywhere. You slump down and rest your back against the largest of them, and catch your breath. [[CONTINUE->CHOUNDS]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You press on through the strange, icy mists, and eventually the hoarfrost stops falling. No land yet catches your eye, though you constantly watch the horizon, which wavers and shifts in the cold fog. In time, your vision blurs and phantoms start to dance in the corners of your eyes—glacier peaks rising from the mist that disappear the moment you turn your head to regard them. Leaden clouds that become gaping mouths, then are once again clouds in the roiling, starless sky. Your weary hand can barely hold the tiller, and only your will keeps your eyes from closing. As the world fades behind your heavy eyelids, you see through the fog the unmistakeable light of lanterns, and the gentle lap of waves on the shore. You are flooded with nostalgia for home. You remember the sounds of your kin cleaning nets, sharpening tools, grinding grain, laughing and chattering. No, it's more than memory - you can hear them through the fog! You can see the lights! ROLL A D20 TO RESIST THE POWER OF THE ILLUSION! (IF YOU CHOOSE, YOU MAY ROLL ANY INSPIRATION DICE AND ADD THEIR TOTALS TO YOUR ROLL IN ORDER TO SUCCEED.) (set: $MirageNumber0 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $MirageNumber0,"") [[Submit Number|Mirage Input0]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue carefully along the river, all senses attuned. You come upon a great valley of jagged ice and slick, black rock. You scrabble down the slope to the valley floor, sending chunks of ice and stone tumbling beneath you. Their crashing echoes around the barren valley. You hear the responding danger before you see it, but not quickly enough to escape being noticed yourself: a rumbling crack pierces the valley's silence, and you feel a low shudder in the ice... [[CONTINUE->ICEGIANT]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You press onward, along the deep-riven coastline. By and by you come to a place where a mighty glacier meets the sea. You climb to its surface, and see the breadth of it extending out, like the back of some great leviathan. Far in the distance where the glacier descends from the mountains, you see a great arched opening in the ice. You strike out torwards it. As you approach you see a cavern carved from a colossal glacier, a cathedral of ice and mist. The silence is profound, broken only by the mournful whisper of the wind. The walls of the great cavern are sheer, polished ice, so clear in places that you can see the veins of captured frost and ancient bubbles of cold air. They gleam with a faint, internal light, a pale luminescence that seems to come from the ice itself, reflecting the cold, distant stars that pierce the perpetual gloom of the realm. The floor is coated in a velvety soft shimmering snow, so fine it feels like powder beneath your boots. In the center, at the back of this great room, a single, grand stall stands. The walls of are not plain, but etched with swirling, intricate patterns of frost that mimic the constellations. The air here is a touch colder, saturated with the faint, sweet scent of frost flowers that bloom only in this frigid realm. But all this registers as secondary to the rhythmic, powerful breathing of a great black horse, who stands patiently in the stall. The faint chink of his icy breath crystallizes on his harness. His mane is a cascade of shimmering rime, his hooves rest on the black, polished ice. This must be Hrimfaxi, the great steed of Nott - Goddess of Night. It is he who pulls the great chariot across the night sky, and the foam from his mouth that makes the dew on the grass! You reach up in awe to touch his mighty withers... [[CONTINUE->HRIMFAXI]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You struggle onwards, and where the narrowing of the fissure walls used to be rare, they are now common. The light filtering down from the mouth of the chasm far above is almost lost, but it is not dark here. The ice itself is luminous - glowing and refracting beams of sunlight like a child at play. The radiant cold presses in on you as the walls do, with a bitter, biting cold. It is a relief, then, when you see the fissure widening ahead. The cold loses its edge of bitterness and you move more quickly along the narrow path. But when you come finally to the opening it is not a wide crystalline hall, it is a prismatic abyss. Crystalline greens, blues, and violets light up the cliff face beneath you down and down until they are lost to your vision. The cracking and groaning of the ice echo all around. Before you, a narrow bridge stretches like a ribbon to the opposite side, wide enough that two might march abrest. Astride the bridge, a mighty hulking figure sits frozen in terrifying immobility. [[CONTINUE->GARM]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You sail on, still trying now and again to gain the attention of those around, but they are universally hostile. Your body aches, and the long hours begin to weigh on you. Finally you moor your ship to a great rock on the banks of the canal, and disembark to rest. You set your back against the rock and try to recover your strength. Your mind begins to wander, then to flounder into darker and darker realms. The canal blurs and becomes imposing shadows that reach out and harry your mind and chase you down dark paths where your legs refuse to run. The light chases you and brighten and brightens, and your heart beats like a frightened rabbit until with a start you awake! [[CONTINUE->DOKKALFAR]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You stick to the well-populated shafts of the mines, and are mostly left alone save some curious glances from the Dark-Elves at work there. In time, the darkness increases, and you realize you will need light. You find a torch that has been cast aside, and light it using one of the many open fires burning here for light. Torch in hand, you continue. The mine continues endlessly. Weariness overtakes you and you sit, resting your back against the cold stone. Your eyes become heavy... [[CONTINUE->GLOKLO]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue threading your way through the maze of working Dvergr. Some work on the crafting of weapons: long swords, axes, and polearms with runes inlaid in the blades of iron and steel and silver. Some work on mighty metal structures that stagger the imagination. Great statues or works of machinery that stretch to unimaginable heights. By and by you hear a sharp shout of authority, and turn to see three armed soldiers chasing you. They address you with rough, guttural voices and weapons at the ready, "What's your business here, Maor?" You tell them of your purpose, and they laugh in response. "Well, Tree-hugger, whatever your quest may be, you're not passing through here without our say-so. And we're not inclined to give it without good reason. Perhaps you could give us one..." And the guard leans forward and touches the god's amulet you wear around your neck." You push his hand away roughly, and the soldiers laugh again, as they advance on you, drawing their weapons. "One way or another, Maor, you will give us a reason." You draw your (print:$weapon) and square your feet. This is not going well... [[CONTINUE->SOLDIER]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You awaken to rough hands, pulling at your clothes and pockets. Your mind is sluggish, and your body falters in response to your will. There is an odd taste on your lips, as if something were poured in your mouth as you slept. As you open your eyes, You see dark figures bobbing overhead, and as you open your eyes further, they coalesce into the faces of several Dvergr in chain-mail armor. But something is odd about your vision. You turn your eyes to the stones of the floor and nearby walls, and they are not inert. They grind slowly and inevitably like great colossae, pushing and flexing to make gold out of dross. You see the Dvergr that surround you, and through their feet and hands the slow life-blood of this realm ripples and pulses like a thick taut rope, thrumming with tension and life. It is the living patience of the realm of deep stone. It is brooding and beautiful. THE EITR OF SVARTALFHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES. (link:'Continue')[ All this you see in a few moments, as your senses return. The rough hands have continued their search and presently they find the (print:$token) in your breast-pocket, and your mind suddenly comes fully awake. With a great roar you kick your assailant off, and scramble back to your feet! You see several Dvergr in chain-mail armor, bearing pole-arms and official colors. They confront you with rough leers. "The Manling awakes! A shame - we were hoping for a quiet search. No matter. Bloodletting makes the prize shinier..." And they encircle you, weapons readied. You reach for your (print: $weapon), but find it has been thrown against a wall out of your reach. You raise your fists and square your feet. This is not going well... [[CONTINUE->HAFGUFA]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> By and by your wanderings along the pitted and cragged coastline bring you to a lagoon running between deep cliffs. You pick up a handful of gravel and throw it in. [[CONTINUE->SCYLLA]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> You continue carefully through the woods, all senses attuned. The woods are quiet and peaceful, and you find yourself feeling refreshed. But it is not to last. [[CONTINUE->TROLL]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 10</h1> By and by the game track peters out to nothing, and you find yourself struggling and hacking through dense-woven brush. You struggle on for hours, until you reach a great pine tree, whose boughs stretch wide. You sit in the shade and catch your breath. [[CONTINUE->HULDRA]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> "Well, Maor, you have earned the attention of the Songcourt. What business has Odin's envoy in my realm?" The voice of Freyr booms. You hesitate, feeling the weight of nine powerful elves glaring ar you with inscrutable eyes. "Speak your piece, Maðr, and speak quickly!" roars Freyr, "You have broken the peace of my kingdom, and stained the ground of Alfheim with innocent blood. By rights I should burn you with mighty fire where you stand!" HOW WILL YOU RESPOND? BEWARE - YOUR CHOICE WILL AFFECT THE DIFFICULTY OF YOUR ROLL! [[INTIMIDATE THE SONGCOURT->AFEAR]] [[GOAD THE SONGCOURT WITH CONTEMPT->ACONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->AAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE THE SONGCOURT BY FLATTERY->AFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH THE SONGCOURT->ABRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO THE SONGCOURT'S HONOR->AHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> You feel the weight of Hel's contemptuous gaze bear down upon you. "Answer, Maðr! I have no time for silver-tongued games!" HOW WILL YOU RESPOND? BEWARE - YOUR CHOICE WILL AFFECT THE DIFFICULTY OF YOUR ROLL! [[INTIMIDATE HEL->HFEAR]] [[GOAD HEL WITH CONTEMPT->HCONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->HAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE HEL BY FLATTERY->HFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH HEL->HBRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO HEL'S HONOR->HHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> You feel the weight of Thrym's contemptuous gaze bear down upon you. [[INTIMIDATE THRYM->JFEAR]] [[GOAD THRYM WITH CONTEMPT->JCONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->JAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE THRYM BY FLATTERY->JFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH THRYM->JBRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO THRYM'S HONOR->JHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> You feel the weight of Surt's contemptuous gaze bear down upon you from his throne of embers. "Speak your peace, Maðr, and be quick about it! I have no patience for silver-tongued games" HOW WILL YOU RESPOND? BEWARE - YOUR CHOICE WILL AFFECT THE DIFFICULTY OF YOUR ROLL! [[INTIMIDATE SURT->MFEAR]] [[GOAD SURT WITH CONTEMPT->MCONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->MAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE SURT BY FLATTERY->MFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH SURT->MBRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO SURT'S HONOR->MHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> You feel the weight of Nott's gaze bear down upon you from her throne of night. "Speak your peace, Maor, and speak truthfully! I am the watcher and keeper of the night, and have seen by night every dark deception the small minds of man have attempted." HOW WILL YOU RESPOND? BEWARE - YOUR CHOICE WILL AFFECT THE DIFFICULTY OF YOUR ROLL! [[INTIMIDATE NOTT->NFEAR]] [[GOAD NOTT WITH CONTEMPT->NCONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->NAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE NOTT BY FLATTERY->NFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH NOTT->NBRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO NOTT'S HONOR->NHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> Mostognir, King of Svartalfheim, holds court in a mighty hall. Tall pillars hewn of stone uphold a soaring arched ceiling, carved with frescoes of the mighty deeds of the Dvergr. You see images of the forging of Mjolnir and Gungnir, the binding of Fenrir by Dvergr chains, the making of Sif's hair, and, at the apex, the birth of Mostognir himself, from the body of the first giant, Ymir. The hall is filled with Dvergr nobles at table, most deep in conversation, some shouting or fighting. Beer and wine flow freely. Mostognir himself is as vast and solid as the kingdom of stone that he rules. He sits mostly in silence, and he watches all with a calculating stare. His great beard flows down in a thick braid, tucked into his belt. His throne is of iron, wrought beautifully and inlaid with all the precious stones and metals from Svartalfheims deep mines. In his hands he holds a great horn, from which he drinks often. When you enter, he affixes you with his gaze, which never leaves you as you approach. You stop when indicated by your soldier escorts, and the silence hangs between you for a long minute. "So, Maor." He grinds from his throne, "I am told that the All-Father has sent an envoy with some strange talk of the end of the world. You are either mad as a wild dog, a charlatan with a tongue of silver, or twice the fool for hearing the All Father's words, then obeying them. Which of these are you, Manling?" HOW WILL YOU RESPOND? BEWARE - YOUR CHOICE WILL AFFECT THE DIFFICULTY OF YOUR ROLL! [[STRIKE FEAR IN THE HEART OF MOSTOGNIR->SFEAR]] [[GOAD MOSTOGNIR WITH CONTEMPT->SCONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->SAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE MOSTOGNIR BY FLATTERY->SFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH MOSTOGNIR->SBRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO MOSTOGNIR'S HONOR->SHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 13</h1> In a haze Vanaheim blurs the recoalesces, and you find yourself in a brightly multihued grove where the Eitr runs through your vision like rain on a spider's web. You feel the weight of Njord's contemptuous gaze bear down upon you. "Answer, Maðr, and be quick about it! I have no patience for silver-tongued games" HOW WILL YOU RESPOND? BEWARE - YOUR CHOICE WILL AFFECT THE DIFFICULTY OF YOUR ROLL! [[INTIMIDATE NJORD->VFEAR]] [[GOAD NJORD WITH CONTEMPT->VCONTEMPT]] [[APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY->VAUTH]] [[MANIPULATE NJORD BY FLATTERY->VFLATTER]] [[STRIKE A DEAL WITH NJORD->VBRIBE]] [[APPEAL TO NJORD'S HONOR->VHON]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> You stumble away from the Songcourt, looking out from the highest point of the Citadel of Ljos. A sheer drop to silver seas far below crash against the rocks. There isn't time to traverse the city before your hour of mercy expires. You mount the railing and, taking aim as best you can, cast yourself over the edge towards the sea, praying for the All-Mother's mercy to guide your fall! (input-box: bind $AlfNumber2,"") [[Submit Number|Alf Input2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> The Songcourt retires, and you are left to walk the halls of the Citadel with Freyr. As you walk he speaks: "What you say holds the weight of truth, but it holds the weight of falsehood as well," Freyr says, his voice losing its warmth and becoming a high, resonating chord. "You are right that the trembles of the World Tree extend here. The harvests of my realm have grown unnaturally sluggish, and the silver shimmer of our seas is strangely dimmed. I have felt a creeping corruption I have not felt since the forging of the first sun. And I suspect a cause." "At the rising of the last new moon, Sigyn, Beloved of Loki, came to the Songcourt. She said that as she tended her husband in his bondage beneath the earth, she sought to ease his sufferings. My realm is the source and wellspring of all peace, built on the stories and songs of the realms below." In all of the Nine Realms, her fate is the greatest in sorrow, and it grieved my heart to hear it, even here. I know what it is to give all for the sake of your beloved. Gerðr, my wife and fairest of the Giants of Jotunheim, consented to marry only if I gave up my very life for her. And so I gave her Sumarbrander, my sword, as a bride-price. With it, I and my realm were to pass through Ragnarok unscathed. Without it, we will fall. But better to end having loved well, than to continue having never loved at all." His voice had become wistful, and for a moment he is quiet as you walk. Then he resumes: Sigyn begged me for leave to go to the Skaldsal - the Hall of Eternal Song, where this realm meets the World Tree, and where the binding songs of all creation are kept secret and safe. She asked only to go and stay there for a time, to learn the eternal songs, and so sing them to Loki. By them would his sufferings be ameliorated. Though it is forbidden that any should go there, I was swayed by her entreaties. Mine is the realm of peace. Should I not give of it freely to her for the sake of another? And she is my kin, and of the Aesgir - how could I not trust her in this? She went to the halls, and returned by and by, filled with the light of song, and well pleased. I thought nothing of it until the tremblings of my world began." Freyr sighs heavily and continues, "I saw no deceit in her then, but I am now filled with doubt. I know not what she accomplished there. Were she the cause of the Tree’s failings, she would be destroying all things, including her own refuge and mine. She knows this as well as any. To do so would be a terrible madness." You listen carefully, and have an intuition that Freyr has not revealed all to you. Not yet. (input-box: bind $AlfNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|Alf Input]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> You flail and crash through a vast plain of slate and dust. The slick, black rock and fine sand send you slipping and scrambling endlessly. Suddenly you hear the permeating cry of Hel, a low and chilling wail like the keening sound of bone rasping on bone. It resonates in the very stones. The earth around you begins to crack and heave, and countless sharp shards erupt from the ground, now bent on your death. (input-box: bind $HelNumber2,"") [[Submit Number|Hel Input2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> Hel regards you with a thoughtful expression. The air around her throne grows impossibly still, and the chilling mist seems to solidify. "What you say holds the weight of truth, and the weight of falsehood," she says finally. "Helheim shudders daily, and the flow of the river Gjöll is fitful as it has never been before. I will admit that I hold foreboding in my breast for a force I cannot understand. I can point to but one cause amongst all, but I also cannot credit that it should be the cause. At the rising of the last new moon, Sigyn, wife to my father Loki, came to me seeking aid. In all of the Nine Realms her loneliness alone is an equal to mine, and her grief is a burden further still. She came to me and spoke of how she and my father were bound beneath Jotunheim, as I am bound to this realm. I felt her sorrow, and it moved me. She asked for a boon. She claimed that she had found a way to ease my father’s suffering for a time. She said she had learned of the Weeping Stone’s power, and with it, she surmised she could break the cords that binds him. I pitied her. I took her to the Weeping Stone of Helheim, where the root that bears this realm meets the World Tree, and its essence flows in and out, giving and receiving of the tree in an unchanging harmony. The tears of the stone are as beautiful as they are sorrowful, and she was silent for many hours. I thought her silence was a solemn recognition of her task, but now the seed of doubt rests uneasy in my mind. She left soon after, and nothing to my knowledge went amiss. It may be she lied to me about her purposes, but I could see no deceit. Were she the cause of the tree's failing, she would be destroying all things, including herself. She knows this as well as any. To do so would be merest madness..." Suddenly you hear the permeating cry of Thrym's horn, a low, grinding bellow like a stone avalanche, resonating in the very rock beneath your feet and in your very bones. The faces of giants appear at doors and windows and around corners, suddenly keenly aware of your presence, and ready to amuse themselves with your flight. (input-box: bind $JotNumber2,"") [[Submit Number|Jot Input2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> Finally, he speaks: "You talk in half-truths, like all your kind. This much is true, though: My kingdom is shaking apart, and the Eitr that feeds it is spitting and hissing. My gut's full of a rage with no head nearby to break. I see a cause, but it's like sour wine if it's true. Last new moon, Loki's wife Sigyn came to me. Said she wanted to ease his whining with stories and pretty lies from all the worlds. She's not ugly, that one. She caught my eye like a prize hound. I took her to see all this world's places: the desolate peaks, the fields of bone, the bitter seas. She smiled for all of them, and I thought maybe I could tempt her away from Loki. That would be a prize. She asked to see more and more, and after a time I took her to see our greatest secret: Mimir's Well, where Ygdrassil roots itself in my kingdom. It's the source of wisdom and knowledge for every world. None go in there without word from me. She was quiet for hours. I thought her heart was turning, so I waited. She left a while later with many smiles, and promised to come back. Nothing was wrong when she left. Not that I could see. I haven't seen her since. She may have some sort of plan, but I can't guess what it is. If she did this to the tree, she's destroying everything including herself. She knows this. That's the blackest kind of madness..." (input-box: bind $JotNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|Jot Input]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> Finally he laughs a grinding slow laugh, "You surprise me, Manling. I had thought your kind hopelessly blind in your devotion to the Aesgir. You are right. I care not at all for the machinations of the gods above. I am before and beyond the Aesgir, and will be after, and their downfall will be my glory. The slow centuries are sweet to me, as I watch the fools above wane, staring down at a fate they can neither flee nor fight. But, it would be the sweeter if their ending were sooner, and at the time of my choosing. I know how the tremblings of the world tree have come to pass. A score of days ago, Sigyn, beloved of Loki, came to me seeking knowledge. She said that she desired vengeance for the punishment wrought upon them by the Aesgir. She sought an ending to the World Tree before Ragnarok's appointed hour. Amusing, is it not, that the Aesgir should fall by the hand of one of their own? I joined my purpose to hers, opening the way to Ginnungagap: where the World Tree finds its root, and my realm meets its mirror, Niflheim. She would not reveal to me the means of her betrayal, but it mattered not. I am the beginning and the end. She could no more hurt me than you could. But I would know the means of her revenge. Nothing passes through my realm without my knowledge, and she should be no different. Come, I will join my purpose to yours. As Surt relates his tale, you cannot help but feel he is concealing something from you... My time will come, for I am before and beyond the Aesgir, and will be after. The slow centuries are sweet to me, as I watch the fools above wane, staring down at a fate they can neither flee nor fight. But you speak the truth. Muspelheim shudders daily, and the flow of the Eitr through it is fitful as it has never before been. I know how this has come to pass. A score of days ago, Sigyn, beloved of Loki, came to me seeking knowledge. She said that she desired vengeance for the punishment wrought upon them by the Aesgir. She sought an ending to the World Tree before Ragnarok's appointed hour. Her plan was utter foolishness. To poison the world tree from its root, by some means she would not reveal to me. I drove her away with laughter. But I did not reckon upon the depths of her deceitful heart. I know not how, but she poisoned my cup with the Eitr of Niflheim, Realm of Ice. My thoughts became clouded and my form slowed. When my wits were again my own, she had gone, I know not where. There can be but one place for her will to come to pass in my realm - Ginnungagap: where the World Tree finds its root, and my realm meets its mirror, Niflheim." "What you say holds the weight of truth, but it holds the weight of falsehood as well," Nott says finally. "The ice rivers of my realm have grown sluggish, and the rime grows strangely thin. A wrongness has come to my daily journey across the sky, a force I have not felt since before the first dawn. And I suspect a cause. "At the rising of the last new moon, Sigyn, beloved of Loki, came to me. The Gods of Aesgir erred, when they condemned Loki to his sufferings, for Sigyn, his Beloved, was fated to suffer thrice what he suffered only once: first for the killing of her sons, and the binding of Loki by their entrails; Second, by the dark and endless vigil she was forced to keep for love, by his side; and third, for the sufferings of her beloved, that she was made to bear witness to. In all of the Nine Realms, the sorrow of her heart is deepest. She spoke to me of being bound beneath Midgard, as I am bound to my path each night. I saw the anguish of a mother in her eyes, and it moved me." "She asked for a boon. She claimed she had found a way to ease her husband's pain. She had learned of the great well Hvergelmir, from which The Bifrost, and all rivers in the Nine Realms flow. She believed its essence could ease the pain, and bring relief. I took her there, where the root that bears this realm meets the World Tree, and its essence flows in and out, in an unchanging harmony." "The great waters of Hvergelmir are magnificent in their power. She laughed with delight at the crash of the might waters, as she collected some of the waters that run from it. I thought it to be joy brought to a joyless heart, but now the seed of doubt rests uneasy in my mind. She left soon after, and nothing to my knowledge went amiss. It may be she lied to me about her purposes, but I saw no deceit." "Were she the cause of the Tree's failing, she would be destroying all things, including herself and her own children. She knows this as well as any. To do so would be a terrible madness." (input-box: bind $SvaNumber2,"") [[Submit Number|Sva Input2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 14</h1> You are escorted to Mostognir's private chambers, and left alone. Mostognir pours wine, then sits and speaks, always with his watchful eyes upon you. "You have heard the tale of the birth of my people, Maor. We were born of the flesh of Ymir, first of the Giants. We feasted upon it, and it made us mighty in craft, for his flesh is the meat of pure creation. His bones are the bedrock of Svartalfheim, and his blood is the Eitr that flows through our realm and makes veins of gold and silver in the rock. If you have seen the Eitr, then you know this. What no man knows is that we are not the only thing that feeds on Ymir's flesh. A root of Ygdrassil is anchored in the Skull of Ymir, and it draws pure potential from his mind. The All-Father and All-Mother know this. They fear me, Maor. All of Asgard's strength they have only by Dvergr craft. At best, they have borrowed the tools of their glory from Dvergr hands, and made no payment for it. So now, Maor, let me tell you another story: Know you the goddess Sigyn, beloved of Loki? Those fool gods above thought their future secure when they bound the trickster god beneath the earth. But they reckoned not with Sigyn. Their arrogance makes them blind. She came to me not long ago, with a plan for unbinding the trickster god. She wished to take of the mind-flesh of Ymir and with it rewrite time itself. She would write into history his unbinding, and set him loose again upon the gods." Mostognir stops to fill his cup again. "She brought every wile she could think to bear upon me: pity, scorn, lies, seduction. But I am Dvergr. We do not bend or break. The flesh of Ymir is sacred, and none save the greatest of us know where it lies. She left in a mad rage, and I let her go. I have heard nothing of her since, but the walls of Svartalfheim tremble, and the Eitr runs slow. If she found her way to the place where Ymir lies and corrupted it by some means, then I must know of her schemes that they might be corrected. It must be kept secret as well, or there will be panic amongst the Dvergr, and the Dark Elves may rebel. Your will and mine converge in this. I need an anonymous agent to go in my stead to Ymir's corpse in secret. You need to fulfill the quest Odin and Frigga have set before you. What say you, Maor?" You cannot be sure, but something about Mostognir's account rings false... He says finally, "Vanaheim shudders daily, and the flow of the eitr through it is fitful as it has never before been. I will admit that I hold fear in my breast for a foe I cannot understand. I can point to but one cause amongst all, but I also cannot credit that it should be the cause. At the rising of the last new moon, Sigyn, wife to Loki, came to me seeking knowledge. She said that as she tended her husband in his bondage beneath the earth, she sought to ease his sufferings for a time with stories and visions of beauty from each of the Nine Worlds. She is passing fair, even amongst the Aesgir, and I will admit she caught my heart and my eye as easily as the sun catches the dew on the grass. I took her to many places of this world: The Everfalls, The Barri Woods, Noatun's Garden. Before all she stood in silence, in what I would have sworn was wonder. And at the end, by many sweet words and against my better judgement, I took her to the Heartwood of Vanaheim, where the branch that bears this great world meets the World Tree, and it's lifeblood flows in and out, giving and receiving of the tree in sustaining harmony. It is beautiful beyond comprehension, and she was silent for many hours in its contemplation. I took her silence for awe, but now the seed of doubt rests uneasy in my mind. She left soon after, and nothing to my knowledge went amiss. It may be she had some ill intent, but I cannot discern it. Were she the cause of the tree's failing, she would be destroying all things, including herself. She knows this as well as any. To do so would be merest madness..." (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->HYLGR]] [[THE BEAR->HYRSA]] [[THE HAWK->HFALKI]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> You turn to the figure looming in the shadows, and see it to be a tall thin giant dressed in rags. In his hands, you are astonished to see, he carries a man's head. But where the flesh should be pale and frozen in rigor, this one has color, and the eyes are those of the living. From the head the rasping voice speaks, "Welcome, Maðr. I am called Mimir, and my silent companion is Fjör-Halda" In response to your astonished gaze, he speaks "Yes, I lost my body ages ago - a tale for another day. For now, time is short and I have much to communicate. One of the great roots of Ygdrassil rests in the bedrock of Jotunheim. Where it meets, and its Eitr flows to and from this world, there is a well that bears my name: Mimir's Well. From it flows the wisdom of the Nine Worlds, and from it I once drank daily, and gave wisdom to kings and gods alike. Long years ago, Thrym removed me from my place at the well, in his arrogance and lust to rule. He thought to prove himself equal to the Aesgir by virtue of possession. All he proved was that the brutish can sometimes take from the wise. I know your quest now, and the trouble that follows you. I have aid for you: a guide..." WHICH BEAST COMPANION HAS COME TO YOUR AID? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->JYLGR1]] [[THE BEAR->JYRSA1]] [[THE HAWK->JFALKI1]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> Thrym speaks again, "I'll tell you what. I'll show you the way to Mimir's Well, if you keep all this to yourself. Find out what she did to it, and fix it, and don't let it get around that I let her through. I'll keep Odin's foolishness as secret, you keep mine, eh?" Thrym gives a strange echoing call, and from the shadows you see the movement of a great figure... WHICH BEAST COMPANION IS TO AID YOU? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->JYLGR]] [[THE BEAR->JYRSA]] [[THE HAWK->JFALKI]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> The storm is slowed to a slumber all around you, as if time itself has ceased. Ash and glass that moments ago whipped through the air now crawl as if restrained by an invisible hand. As you stand and regard the silent squall in confusion and wonder, a great beast emerges from the heavy-laden air. WHICH BEAST COMPANION HAS COME TO YOUR AID? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->MYLGR1]] [[THE BEAR->MYRSA1]] [[THE HAWK->MFALKI1]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> Surt speaks again: "It is forbidden that I should go to Ginninngagap before Ragnarok, lest I be unmade. You must go in my stead, and find what Sigyn's hand has wrought. You will take with you my appointed guide, who will see to it that my will is done in that place." WHICH BEAST COMPANION IS TO AID YOU? As you do, the growing darkness of the land is lit by a grey glow. From the black shadows of the cave, a great beast emerges: WHICH BEAST COMPANION HAS COME TO YOUR AID? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->NYLGR1]] [[THE BEAR->NYRSA1]] [[THE HAWK->NFALKI1]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> Nott speaks again: "The time comes for me to draw the night across the sky. You will take with you a guide, who will see to it that my will is done at Hvergelmir." WHICH BEAST COMPANION IS TO AID YOU? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->NYLGR]] [[THE BEAR->NYRSA]] [[THE HAWK->NFALKI]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> A nimbus of blue light freezes everything, and a mighty hulking figure emerges around a corner... Everyone is frozen in place... WHICH BEAST COMPANION HAS COME TO YOUR AID? I will send the most faithful of my beasts with you, as guide and ally..." WHICH BEAST COMPANION IS TO AID YOU? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->SYLGR]] [[THE BEAR->SYRSA]] [[THE HAWK->SFALKI]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> You turn all around seeking a way of escape, but none appears. With every passing moment the branches close in on you, until you are caught like a rabbit in a game trap. But as hope fades and dies in your breast, the malevolent branches suddenly withdraw, as if in fear and deference to some greater will than their own. From the shadows of the retreating woods, a great beast emerges... WHICH BEAST COMPANION HAS COME TO YOUR AID? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->VYLGR1]] [[THE BEAR->VYRSA1]] [[THE HAWK->VFALKI1]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 15</h1> Njord speaks: "You must go to the Heartwood and see. If she has truly wrought some mischief upon the tree from this plane, it will surely be there. I will not come with you - my shame is too great to revisit that place. My penance for this will be to not look upon the Heartwood of Vanaheim until the horns of Ragnarok sound, and I am called to the Last Battle. I will send with you a guide, though." And Njord gives a strange echoing call, and from the surrounding forest you see the movements of a great beast... WHICH BEAST COMPANION IS TO AID YOU? (Select the beast mini from your calendar) [[THE WOLF->VYLGR]] [[THE BEAR->VYRSA]] [[THE HAWK->VFALKI]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> The great beast turns and leads you along the shore to a cave, nigh invisible from any vantage point. A steep descending path leads down from here deep into the bedrock of Alfheim. The way is treacherous, and you descend for many hours, but the song of the stones rings louder and louder as you do, and the harmonies layer and become still richer, until you are nearly overwhelmed. It is sublime! And then you come to what can only be the Skaldsal. The glowing stones of the narrow way open up, and the narrow path becomes wide, then opens up to a mighty cathedral, whose golden heights disappear above you! The infinite harmony of every voice of creation thrums in your chest, and the walls, and the floor, and the very air you breathe! (link: "Continue")[ But the harmony is tainted. You can hear and feel it. A note of discord makes the Eternal Songs waver. You hear them pulling and shifting to make harmonies again from cacophony, but the discord changes and shifts, wilfully distorting the weave of voices. The wavering discord grates on your soul like the scars of fresh grief. You cannot yet sense its source, but it is near. You begin to sing, keying your voice to the discordant note, letting it rise and mingle with the sounds of the hall, and lending them the strength of your voice. The cacophonous discord reacts to you, and you feel the driving pain of a sharp sliver in your mind! ROLL A D20 TO MAINTAIN YOUR SONG IN THE FACE OF THE DISCORD! (set: $D16ANumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16ANumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16A Input]] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> The great creature turns and you follow, out of the cave and into the now-silent plain of jagged slate. She leads you a long wandersome way for many days, through wild mountain passes, across open desert, and deep into the secret places of Helheim. You come by and by to a darkened canyon. After many days walking its narrow path, increasingly deep and enclosed by rocky walls, you come to an unimaginably vast chamber. The high lip of the canyon far above you is a tiny crack that seems to split the sky, and neither ceiling nor walls can be seen around you. The center of it is dominated by a great gem, lit from within by a luminous blackness. White light runs down it like the tears of a dying sun. This is the Weeping Stone. (link: "Continue")[ But not all of the Weeping Stone's light runs clear. Near where the root meets the bedrock of Helheim, a sickly, luminous green ichor extends ever-spreading fingers upwards. Where it touches, the tears of light slow and curdle into a foul sludge, and the movements of the stone's energy slow and sputter. You approach, and at the epicenter of the blighting, a great, blackened fang has been cruelly driven into the Weeping Stone. It is twice taller than a man, and the stench from it is like a blow, a soul-chilling miasma that chokes your lungs until you are forced back. ROLL A D20 TO MUSTER THE STRENGTH TO PUSH PAST THE FANG'S POISON CLOUD! ] (set: $D16HNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16HNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16 Input]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> You take your leave of Mimir, and travel down through the giant streets. You expect to be led out into the wilderness of Jotunheim, but instead, the great creature who is your companion leads you a long wandersome way down into the heart of the city, through narrow causeways, and deep into the catacombs beneath the streets. You come by and by to a mighty chamber, clearly the deepest place in City of Utgard, and the house of its Cornerstone. On a dais in the center, rises light from a great well, overflowing with waters of a blinding brilliance, like fire made liquid. Up the sides of the dais run the unmistakeable pattern of Ygdrassil's roots. This is Mimir's Well. (link: "Continue")[ But there is a fault in the overflowing white fire. At it's edge on one side, where the gnarled patterns of Ygdrassil's roots are visible, a sickening blackness extends ever-spreading tendrils upwards. Where it touches, the white fire runs black, and the flames lick backwards over the lip of the well, and into the fires themselves. The black tendrils swirl and mingle with the white, and they are spreading slowly but visibly, stilling the flames as they touch them. You approach, and at the epicenter of the blighting a great fang has been cruelly driven into the wall of the spring. It is twice taller than a man, and the stench from it is like a blow, choking and cloying your lungs until you are forced back. ROLL A D20 TO MUSTER THE STRENGTH TO PUSH PAST THE FANG'S POISON CLOUD! ] (set: $D16JNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16JNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16J Input]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> You take your leave of Thrym, and travel down through the giant streets. You expect to be led out into the wilderness of Jotunheim, but instead, the great creature who is your companion leads you a long wandersome way down into the heart of the city, through narrow causeways, and deep into the catacombs beneath the streets. You come by and by to a mighty chamber, clearly the deepest place in City of Utgard, and the house of its Cornerstone. On a dais in the center, rises light from a great well, overflowing with waters of a blinding brilliance, like fire made liquid. Up the sides of the dais run the unmistakeable pattern of Ygdrassil's roots. This is Mimir's Well. (link: "Continue")[ But there is a fault in the overflowing white fire. At it's edge on one side, where the gnarled patterns of Ygdrassil's roots are visible, a sickening blackness extends ever-spreading tendrils upwards. Where it touches, the white fire runs black, and the flames lick backwards over the lip of the well, and into the fires themselves. The black tendrils swirl and mingle with the white, and they are spreading slowly but visibly, stilling the flames as they touch them. You approach, and at the epicenter of the blighting a great fang has been cruelly driven into the wall of the spring. It is twice taller than a man, and the stench from it is like a blow, choking and cloying your lungs until you are forced back. ROLL A D20 TO MUSTER THE STRENGTH TO PUSH PAST THE FANG'S POISON CLOUD! (set: $D16JNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16JNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16J Input]] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> The great beast turns and you follow her out of Surt's throneroom and into the swirling inferno. She leads you a long, blistering way, through obsidian hills and rivers of molten gold, and across the scorched plains, always towards a great range of mountains that extend like knives into the burning sky. As you draw closer their true scale is revealed: Their base extends to the ends of the horizon. Their peaks escape your eyes in their height, seeming to slash the very sky. Your guide takes you up these mountains by paths your eyes cannot discern in the steep slopes. The way is narrow and treacherous, and often your foot slips and you fear your end has come, but you press on. And after long hours and days that seem to blend and blur you come to the heights of the mountain range. The peaks that spear the sky are themselves cracked along their length into a great chasm filled with prismatic undulant light. Opposite you, the lip of the chasm is a mirror of jagged ice and fog to the world in which you stand. Your vision, colored by the Eitr of this fiery realm, reveals a mighty flow like a waterfall of cinder and ember, mingling and falling away with a great roaring into the mountain's depths. As you stare into those depths they become translucent, and you see not a rocky chasm, but the great trunk of Ygdrassil. Here, the World Tree's roots reach down to the ancient fires, and draw them in, sustaining itself and holding up all realms of Creation. (link: "Continue")[ But with the Eitr flowing over the lip of the chasm and down is a slow drip of black ichor, falling from above. Where it meets the Eitr's flow to the Great Tree, the bright fires sputter and die, and are poured in to the root of the World Tree as a sluggish poison, rendering the roots brittle and barren. You follow the path of this slow poison upwards with your eyes to its source. Far out over the chasm, a Great Black Fang hovers in an ornate crystalline vitrine, rotating slowly. Down its length runs the blackness. This must be the source of the blight! Seeing no other way across, you gage the distance, and with a great leap, throw yourself towards the shining crystal. ROLL A D20 TO MUSTER THE STRENGTH FOR THIS GREAT LEAP! (set: $D16MNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16MNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16M Input]] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> The great beast turns and you follow her out of Nott's hall and into the swirling mists. She leads you a long, harrowing way, through broken plains of jagged black ice and great valleys of patient, long-frozen stone. You travel, by and by, to a great river of slow-moving ice, and you turn with your guide and follow it. The river's course is joined by another, and then another still, until its mighty flow is a clamourous roar in your ears. You press onward. In the distance, the curtain of the sky is dominated by a shimmering prismatic dance of color climbing from a point beyond the horizon up into the sky, and disappearing. It grows and grows as you travel, until all is bathed in the shimmering refracted rainbow of the Bifrost. And finally, you arrive at the source of all rivers: Hvergelmir. It's edged are cracked, eternal black stone, the bedrock of Niflheim. From it, to every point of the compass, waters of the Nine Realms flow outwards. At its center, you can see a roiling maelstrom, colored the deepest chromatic hues. You know these colors - these are the headwaters of the Bifrost! Your vision, attuned as it is to this world, sees the maelstrom of Hvergelmir as a swirling torrent of Eitr, from which all waters coming into being. It is sublime. (link: "Continue")[ But twined with the swirling creation of the rime-laden Eitr is a more insidious darkness, and where the dark meets the rimelight, the latter slows and sludges, starving the water's flow. You cannot see the source of the dark - it is somewhere in the roiling center of Hvergelmir's waters. HOW WILL YOU INVESTIGATE HVERGELMIR? [[INVOKE THE FAVOR OF YOUR GOD! (ROLL A D20 AGAINST A MEDIUM DC, BUT YOU MUST ALSO ROLL AND ADD THE HIGHEST VALUE DIE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL (LIKELY A PERCENTILE OR D20 DIE)!)->NFAVOR]] [[CONVINCE YOUR ANIMAL COMPANION TO HELP! (ROLL A D20 AGAINST A LOW DC, BUT YOU LOSE A DIE OF YOUR CHOICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL!))->NAHANDLE]] [[DIVE INTO THE WATERS AND SWIM (ROLL A D20 AGAINST A HIGH DC!->NSWIM]] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> You expect to be led out and away from the bustling Dvergr city, but instead, (print:$animal) leads you a long wandersome way down into the heart of the Hammarrskorr, through narrow causeways, and deep into the mines beneath the city that seem to honeycomb all of Svartalfheim. You make your way through active mines, where Dvergr and Dark Elves alike avoid your gaze, or flee at your coming. Then the mines become dark, forgotten byways, following the deep veins of precious metals far past the reach of the Dvergr's current lamps. You climb ancient cave-ins and fight or sneak past the lairs of monstrous beasts that dwell in the primordial darkness. Ever and always (print:$animal) is your guide, first cold and aloof, but gradually warming to you as friend. By your journeys end, you sleep side-by-side by night, and journey by day shoulder to shoulder as trusted friends. By and by the journey does end in a vast, subterranean void. The ancient stone walls disappear into darkness all around, and the floor itself is akin to a polished obsidian emptiness. There are no edges or boundaries, just a blackened mirror-surface disappearing into darkness. You stare into the reflected depths of the obsidian floor and see not just your own reflection, but the colossal hulking carcass of what can only be Ymir. Enormous bones jut from the emaciated sides of the corpse, and a span further on, you see a massive partially decomposed skull. Inside it you see a brilliant gold that flashes and winks, hidden as it is... (link: "Continue")[ But all this is beyond your reach on the far side of the glassy floor. You strike it with your (print:$weapon), but it deflects harmlessly away, leaving neither scratch nor dent. You place your hand on the floor, feeling the cold smoothness, and feel the Eitr of Svartalfheim that dwells within you pulled into the glass! You place both hands on the floor, and will the flow of the Eitr into it. Your hands begin to sink into it! ROLL A D20 TO BRING THE EITR TO BEAR UPON THE GLASS! (set: $D16SNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16SNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16S Input]] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 16</h1> The great creature turns and you follow her into the woods. She leads you a long wandersome way for many days, through wild mountain passes, across open plains, and deep into the secret places of Vanaheim. You come by and by to a deep cave, and after many days in the dark, you come to the root of the mountain - an unimaginably vast cavern, in which neither ceiling nor walls can be seen. The center of it is dominated by a colossal column, so vast as to hold up the sky itself. It pulsates and crackles with living color - a fire that runs up and down it's breadth and into the unseen heights. This is the Heartwood of Vanaheim. (link: "Continue")[ But not all of the Heartwood runs colored and flashes fire. Near where the root meets the bedrock of Vanaheim, a sickening blackness extends ever-spreading fingers upwards. Where it touches, the fire slows and dies, and all movements of the Eitr in the veins of the tree cease. You approach, and at the epicenter of the blighting a great fang has been cruelly driven into the Heartwood. It is twice taller than a man, and the stench from it is like a blow, choking and cloying your lungs until you are forced back. ROLL A D20 TO MUSTER THE STRENGTH TO PUSH PAST THE FANG'S POISON CLOUD! (set: $D16VNumber1 to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $D16VNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|D16V Input]] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 17</h1> Your song twins once again with the Eternal Songs of the Skaldsal, and now you can sense in the song's harmonies that the discord now hides from your ear, seeking the places on the edges of the song, but still pouring its insidious blight into it. You bring your voice to bear, chasing it down through tone and chord, in and out of the twining harmonies in a desperate chase! It sears your skin, and you cry out! The blackness that seeps from it runs down your arm, burning a runnelling pattern into your flesh, but you feel it shift against whatever magic holds it here! (input-box: bind $D17NNumber,"") [[Submit Number|D17 NInput]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 17</h1> You turn to the great cadaver of Ymir, stretched out in ancient majesty before you. The golden glimmer emanating from his skull is brighter and more alive here. You approach and climb up the skull, standing finally in the enormous eye socket. You can see Ymir's mind-flesh, brilliant white gold, and the mighty root of Ygdrassil extending down into it. The Eitr of Svartalfheim courses through the Tree's root in a twisting undulating channel. It is beautiful. But it is not pure. Where the root meets Ymir's mind-flesh, you can see a great black fang has been stabbed cruelly into Ygdrassil's root. Venom drips from the fang into the golden flow of Eitr and where it does its darkness dissipates outward fractally, like dye in water. This must be the source of the Blight! You climb with great care around the skull and up to where the root meets the mind-flesh at the great fang. It is too large for human hands to grasp and pull from the wound, but you must try! USE UP DICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL UNTIL YOU MEET OR EXCEED A TOTAL VALUE OF 15! (set: $D17SNumber to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL! (input-box: bind $D17SNumber,"") [[Submit Number|D17 SInput]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 17</h1> You set your shoulder to the fang and pour your strength into it. By your side (print: $animal) sets her strength alongside yours. As you do, the Heartwood itself senses your need and its fires bend to aid you, pressing and shuddering to drive the fang from its side. USE UP DICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL UNTIL YOU MEET OR EXCEED A TOTAL VALUE OF 15! (set: $D17VNumber to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL! (input-box: bind $D17VNumber,"") [[Submit Number|D17 VInput]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 18</h1> Many days later, following in the footfalls of your companion, you return to the Citadel of Ljos. Freyr rises when you gain audence and regards you quietly. "What have you found?" You throw the now-shrivelled great fang on the table, and he lifts it to his eye. The colors and songs of Alfheim twist around him suddenly, as realization strikes him. "This is a fang of Jormungandr - the World Serpent. This must be by the hand of Sigyn, but I cannot understand. The death of Ygdrassil is the death of all! What madness has driven her to this?" You must go to Asgard! Find the All-Father! While weak, he may be able to draw out the shape of Sigyn's plan, and how it might be unmade. Go, warrior! There is no time to lose!" And with a gesture he sends you whirling and twisting in the winds to land on the deck of your ship once more. YOU ARE BACK ON YOUR SHIP, AND IT IS INTACT! [[CONTINUE->DAY18A2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 18</h1> Many days later, following in the footfalls of (print:$animal), you return to Hel's Throneroom. She rises and regards you coldly. "What have you found, Maor?" You throw the now-shrivelled great fang on the table, and she picks it up and inspects it. The colors of Helheim twist suddenly, as realization strikes her. "This is a fang of Jormungandr - the World Serpent. This must be by the hand of Sigyn, but I cannot understand. The death of Ygdrassil is the death of all! What madness has driven her to this?" You must go to Asgard! Find the All-Father! While weak, he may be able to draw out the shape of Sigyn's plan, and how it might be unmade. Go, warrior! There is no time to lose!" And with a gesture she sends you and your companion whirling and twisting in the winds to land on the deck of your ship once more. YOU ARE BACK ON YOUR SHIP, AND IT IS INTACT! TAKE THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D10) AND ADD IT TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE->DAY18H2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 18</h1> A thought occurs to you - Mimir's Well is the great fount of all knowledge of the Nine Realms. Surely here in the white fires of its pool, the answer lies. You stretch out your hands and, with no small fear, press them into the fires of the well. Immediately, your mind is split open with an inrushing knowledge too broad for any human mind! You see all, but only with a rending pain! You set your will against it, and as you do you are given images of the well where you stand. You see yourself - your hands in the waters, then you blur and become Thrym, staring greedily into the depths, then Mimir's head, cloven from its body. And finally as your consciousness races towards blackness, you see the face of Sigyn, wife of Loki, tearing a fang from the gaping maw of Jormungandr, the World Serpent. Then again she blurs and appears, approaching the Well with a mad purpose in her eyes, and the fang in her hands. You see her drive it with all the force of a century's hatred into it's side, and laugh a high cackling laugh as the white fire blackens. And then with a cry you are thrown back from the Well, and you are lying, staring at the high ceiling, breathing hard. You must go to Asgard! Find the All-Father! While weak, he may yet know how Sigyn's plans might be undone! There is no time to lose! TAKE THE DIE FROM TODAY (A D10) AND ADD IT TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE->DAY18J2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 18</h1> Your return through the obsidian floor to your companion, and then after long journey to the halls of Mostognir once again. He rises and regards you. "What have you found?" You throw the great fang on the table, and he lifts it to his eye. He inspects it and grows pale. "This is a fang of Jormungandr - the World Serpent. This must be by the hand of Sigyn. She would destroy me and my people. What madness has driven her to this? "This is too much even for just the Dvergr-folk! Return to your ship and to Asgard. Be quick, Manling! You may already be too late!" You are rushed to your ship in all haste by a group of Dvergr, set to running with the fear of death in them! YOU ARE BACK ON YOUR SHIP, AND IT IS INTACT - TAKE THE DIE FROM TODAY AND ADD IT TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE->DAY18S2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 18</h1> Many days later, following in the footfalls of your companion, you return to Njord's grove. He rises and regards you quietly. "What have you found?" You throw the now-shrivelled great fang on the table, and he lifts it to his eye. The colors of Vanaheim twist suddenly, as realization strikes him. "This is a fang of Jormungandr - the World Serpent. This must be by the hand of Sigyn, but I cannot understand. The death of Ygdrassil is the death of all! What madness has driven her to this?" You must go to Asgard! Find the All-Father! While weak, he may be able to draw out the shape of Sigyn's plan, and how it might be unmade. Go, warrior! There is no time to lose!" And with a gesture he sends you whirling and twisting in the winds to land on the deck of your ship once more. YOU ARE BACK ON YOUR SHIP, AND IT IS INTACT! [[CONTINUE->DAY18V2]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 19</h1> You are swirled and reeled through the eddies of the Bifrost. The waters are not cold, indeed they are not even waters. But even so, it is a struggle to breathe. You are plunged beneath the surface again and again, pounded and spun until time and tide have no meaning. For a moment, all resolves, and you can see the branching of the Bifrost into a thousand thousand tributaries. From beside you, to your surprise, (print: $animal) is still with you, calm and quiet even in the chaos of the waves. She motions to you, indicating a dividing stream of the Bifrost on your right. With what little strength you have left, you kick out, following them in the hopes they know the way. ROLL A D20 TO SEE HOW WELL ATTUNED YOU ARE TO YOUR BEAST COMPANION AS YOU NAVIGATE THE BIFROST! BECAUSE YOUR SHIP HAS CAPSIZED AS YOU ENTERED THE BIFROST YOUR TASK WILL BE MORE DIFFICULT! YOU'LL ROLL YOUR D20 TWICE AND TAKE THE LOWER OF THE TWO ROLLS. (THIS IS CALLED 'DISADVANTAGE'.) YOU CAN ALSO STILL USE DICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL IF YOU CHOOSE. (set: $ABIFROST to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $ABIFROST,"") (link: "Submit Number")[ (set: _inputNum to (num: $ABIFROST)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die6") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 8)[ (go-to: "ABIFROSTPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 8)[ (go-to: "ABIFROSTFAIL") ] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 19</h1> The prismatic waters buffet your ship as you are swept along at impossible speed through the winding riverway. A thousand thousand branches and tributaries divide and divide, but at the prow (print: $animal) stands, indicating the way by the turning of her head to port and starboard. Without her, you would undoubtedly be lost in the winding ways forever and pass from memory. As it is you brace your feet and keep your eye to your guide, following the course she sets. ROLL A D20 TO SEE HOW WELL ATTUNED YOU ARE TO YOUR BEAST COMPANION AS YOU NAVIGATE THE BIFROST! BECAUSE YOU MANAGED TO ENTER THE BIFROST WITHOUT DAMAGE TO YOUR SHIP, YOU'LL ROLL WITH ADVANTAGE! THIS MEANS, YOU'LL ROLL YOUR D20 TWICE AND TAKE THE HIGHER OF THE TWO ROLLS. YOU CAN ALSO STILL USE DICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL IF YOU CHOOSE. (set: $AANIMAL to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $AANIMAL,"") (link: "Submit Number")[ (set: _inputNum to (num: $AANIMAL)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die6") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 10)[ (go-to: "AANIMALPASS") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 10)[ (go-to: "AANIMALFAIL") ] ]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 2</h1> "Make ready your armament, child, and be swift! We will send you by the dawning of the sun.” You rise, all thought of sleep departed. The dark of night still clings to Midgard. But in the East, the first gentle touch of the dawning sun is touching the horizon. Time is short! You track well-worn steps to the armory. (set: $WeaponNumber to "0") CHOOSE YOUR WEAPON! (Roll the D6 from today, and Submit the result below!) (input-box: bind $WeaponNumber, "") [[Submit Number|Weapon Input]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 20</h1> Each of you, in your wanderings in the Nine Realms, have felt the flow of that realm's Eitr in your veins. The world tree lives and breathes from the Eitr of all worlds, and should the flow of one be stoppered, it spells the doom of all. We must restore the flow of the Eitr to Ygdrassil. That flow must come from the Great Tree's Crown, here at the peak of Asgard, and from the Foot of the Eversteps, deep at the root of Tree. Your blood must be the wellspring from which life will flow again to her branches and roots. I will grant unto each what little strength remains to me. It will heal your wounds, and give you knowledge of the path to each destination. Choose which you will - there must be as many as can be mustered at each point, giving of their lifeblood for the life of Ygdrassil. Will you do this? A great cheer goes up from the company, and immediately each according to his will departs with comrades - half to the Crown of Ygdrassil, and half to the Eversteps. WHICH WILL YOU CHOOSE? [[THE EVERSTEPS]] OR [[THE CROWN OF YGDRASSIL]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 21</h1> You follow the gold thread laid across your vision upward to the highest point of Asgard, and find that the branches of Ygdrassil ascend still higher. You begin to climb. You climb for hours, moving hands and feet carefully from limb to limb, onward toward the starred sky and the canopy of the World Tree. The leaves of Ygdrassil are as delicate as snowflakes, and formed of purest gold and silver. A wind moves through them, and they rustle and shift with a faroff music. At length it comes to you that their rustlings are not the familiar sussurus of Midgard's trees, but resolve into words - a gentle song, the refrain of which is the same line over and over: //"The crown is reached by the warrior who falls..."// WHAT WILL YOU DO? [[CONTINUE CLIMBING THE GREAT TREE]] [[TAKE THE AMULET OF THE GOD'S FAVOR FROM YOUR NECK, AND LET IT FALL]] [[DROP YOUR WEAPON]] [[DROP YOUR SHIELD]] [[LET GO OF THE TREE]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 21</h1> The Eversteps descend in a spiral. Immediately as you descend, the path behind you disappears, and the steps before you open up in eternal monotony. Eventually all sense of time is lost, along with any notion of how far you have travelled or how far there is further to go. You are not alone, though. Beside you, (print:$animal) still travels faithfully, patient as a stone. When your steps falter, she lends you her strength, until you can walk again. At length, it comes to your attention that the rough bark of the walls has texture and feel to it. Nor is the roughness random. It is words, repeated endlessly across the surface. //"The way forward is the way back.."// WHAT DO YOU DO?" [[CONTINUE DESCENDING THE EVERSTEPS]] [[SPIN IN CIRCLES]] [[TURN BACK AND ASCEND THE STAIRS]] [[SET DOWN YOUR WEAPON AND CONTINUE DOWN THE STEPS]] [[SET DOWN YOUR SHIELD AND CONTINUE DOWN THE STEPS]] [[SET DOWN YOUR WEAPON AND ASCEND THE STEPS]] [[SET DOWN YOUR SHIELD AND ASCEND THE STEPS]]<h1>CALENDAR DAY 22</h1> You look around and see with you other warriors of Midard tasked, as you have been, with turning back the blight. You turn to each other, and for a moment there is a deep pause, as all remember the words of the All-Father: "Your blood must be the wellspring from which life will flow again to the World Tree." [[CONTINUE->DAY 22C2]]You draw your blade across your palm and let the blood flow freely, falling on the golden surface of Ygdrassil's Crown. As you do, your hand is caught and held in place by an unseen force. You feel the Eitr of your home - Midgard, and that of the world you explored, pulled from your veins and into the Tree. As it does you see the color of the world swirl from your hand and the hands of all who stand there with you. It pours onto the ground and outward like wine poured into water, mingling in the depths of the canopy and spreading outward and downwards. You will the Eitr to leave you, to nourish the World Tree, and the pool grows! ROLL A D20 EIGHT TIMES (ONE FOR YOU AND EACH OF YOUR FELLOW WARRIORS). ADD THE TOTALS AS YOU GO. THEN ADD DICE FROM YOUR DICE POOL TO REACH THE REQUIRED TOTAL IF NECESSARY! (YOU MUST MEET OR EXCEED A TOTAL OF 90!) (set: $CBLEED to "0") ENTER YOUR TOTAL ROLL! (input-box: bind $CBLEED,"") [[Submit Total|CBLEED Input]]You draw your blade across your palm and with your fellow warriors, place your hand on the undulant surface of the Seed. As you do, your hand is caught and held to the Seed by an unseen force. You feel the Eitr of your home - Midgard, and that of the world you explored, pulled from your veins and into the stone. As it does you see the color of the world swirl from your hand and the hands of all who touch the stone, into the transparent core of the seed. You will the Eitr to leave you, to nourish the World Tree, and it's glow increases in strength! ROLL A D20 EIGHT TIMES (ONE FOR YOU AND EACH OF YOUR FELLOW WARRIORS). ADD THE TOTALS AS YOU GO.
