[[CONTINUE->SoldiersDMG]]<h2>DEFEAT!</h2> You've driven your attackers back, for the moment, but only at the cost of grevious wounds to your body and mind. The Dvergr soldiers see your weakness and grin, knowing they have you now. At a signal they rush you and bear you to the ground, stabbing and chopping at you mercilessly. Your vision narrows and your mind fades as it is electrified by pain.. But you do not die, and even the deep and visceral pain you should feel clears like mist at the dawn in merest moment. But no sun rise comes. Instead, you are spinning and falling endlessly down and down and down - the colors of the worlds mix and mingle as you tumble for what seems an eternity. And then you are not falling, you are sinking in a mire that pulls at your boots and clings to your skin like the touch of the dead. And all around you stretch the endless windswept wastelands: Helheim. You rise, and while the fearsome wounds from your combat are still present, they are as far-away reminders of a fading nightmare. The blood that should be coursing from them is frozen in time, like a winter stream. What is this place? (link: "Continue")[The mud near you coalesces like fingers grasping at the air, growing and congealing towards the shape of a body. The runnels of muck resolve into features, first vague, then clear and alive. Then an arm reaches out from it, becoming a tendril, that wraps with the inevitability of a snake's coils around your neck. A face emerges and turns to you - the face of a goddess: beautiful and hollow and terrible. A voice like a final whisper permeates your mind, "Who are you, and what business have you in the realm of the dead?" He roars at you in a dark, sharp tongue, that rips the air like claws in flesh. USE THE DIE FROM YOUR CALENDAR (A PERCENTILE DIE) TO ROLL FOR DAMAGE! ADD DICE FROM YOUR INSPIRATION POOL IF YOU WANT! [[Continue|SoldiersDMG]]<h2>VICTORY!</h2> You time your final dodge, and redirect the momentum of your attackers into each other! They collide in a chaotic mass of limbs. You shove them violently, sending them both flailing to the ground. You slam your weapon into the chest of one, then the other, and shout in your rage, "BEGONE THIEVES AND PARASITES, OR I WILL SATE THE HUNGER OF MY BLADE WITH YOUR LIVES!" There is a moment of silence, then those who can scrabble to their feet and flee, streaming blood from their wounds. You catch the foot of one sending her sprawling again, and hold your (print:$weapon) to her throat. "You will stay." You say to her, flatly. (link: "Continue")[ The Dvergr soldier you've captured holds your gaze with wide, frightened eyes. "What do you want from me?" "I want to speak to the ruler of this realm." You growl, "But I will settle for speaking to your superior for the time being. Lead me there!" And you kick her to her feet. She scrambles up and with many backwards glances leads you through the maze of worktables and forges. By and by you come to what can only be a barracks. Soldiers move in and out of it with the bored expressions of soldiers everywhere. You approach causes a great stir, and you are soon surrounded by a bristling circle of blades. You grab your captive by the collar and hold your blade ready. "I would speak to the commander of this barracks. You will bring me to them or this one will die." The soldier you have hostage whimpers. A fat Dvergr in finer armor steps forward. He eyes you speculatively, then says, "I command this place. Kill that one if you want. I have no use for a soldier that cannot perform her duties." Turning to the soldiers who surround you he barks out a terse command, "Kill the manling, then clean it up. I don't want to hear about this again." [[CONTINUE->SVA3]] ]You pick up your spear from the corner where it leans. Its sharp hungry tip gleams and flickers in the torchlight and its grip feels familiar in your hand. This will serve you well. You pick up your shield and turn to the wall of armor... ADD THE D6 YOU JUST ROLLED TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[DAY 3]]The shimmering, ethereal presence of the God Baldr flickers before you, a pale memory of light. Upon his chest, the wound from Höðr's mistletoe arrow is open and bleeds still. "I know of your quest, Maor," he murmurs, his voice a distant chime, like a bell heard through deep water, "And while I have passed on from the living, my power here is not yet dissipated. I have this last gift for one sent to save the World Tree." Around your neck, an amulet wrought of steel appears - the symbol of the risen sun in all its glory. It is warm to the touch, and you are heartened. "This holds the last vestiges of my strength. As I give up my power for your sake, I commission you also to give of yourself for the sake of all creation. My amulet will guide your hand through the gloom and be a strength to you when your strength fails." Then his form shimmers and fades. As it does, he speaks once again, "It is time - the All-Father will soon open the way to the Bifrost. Make ready, and watch for horizon to split. Fair winds, Warrior!" (set: $amulet to "Sun Pendant") [[DAY 6]] //Maor is the norse word for 'person' or 'human' // //In Norse Mythology, the mischievous god Loki tricks the blind god Höðr into killing his radiant brother, Baldr. Loki reveals that Baldr is invulnerable to all things except the mistletoe, a plant his mother, Frigg, overlooked when making other beings swear not to harm Baldr. Loki then guides Höðr's hand to throw a dart made of mistletoe, which strikes and kills Baldr, a tragedy that signifies the coming of Ragnarök. //(set: _inputNum to (num: $SvaNumber2)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die3Sc") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 14)[ (go-to: "SvaSPASS1") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 14)[ (go-to: "SvaSFAIL1") ] [[SvaSPASS1]] [[SvaSFAIL1]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die3Sc]](set: _inputNum to (num: $SvaNumber2)) (if: _inputNum is not a number)[ (go-to: "Rocks Fall And You Die3Sa") ] (else-if: _inputNum >= 12)[ (go-to: "SvaDPASS1") ] (else-if: _inputNum < 12)[ (go-to: "SvaDFAIL1") ] [[SvaDPASS1]] [[SvaDFAIL1]] [[Rocks Fall And You Die3Sa]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> You dodge and weave desperately through the streets of Utgard, scrambling over rubble and shoving past colossal statues. Your flight is in vain - you race around a corner and run headlong into a company of Dvergr soldiers, weapons raised. They close in on you with wicked leers, and raise their weapons to end your life... YOU SURVIVED, BUT THERE IS A COST! TODAY'S DIE ISN'T ADDED TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 15->DAY 15SDD]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You dodge and weave desperately through the streets of Hammarsskor, scrambling over rubble and shoving past colossal statues. The thundering footsteps of your pursuers echo off the black stone walls, and the roar of their voices resonates in the air behind you. By some miracle, the sounds of pursuit fade. You take a breathless moment to assess your surroundings. The alleyways here are narrow and broken, and there is no noise save the now faraway sounds of your pursuers. You pad carefully down a side alley, seeking a place to hide... ADD THE D20 FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 15->DAY 15SD]]<h2>FAILURE!</h2> You dismiss your hunch. Mostognir seems to speak truly. Sigyn must have some secret purpose apart from his knowledge [[CONTINUE TO DAY 15->DAY 15SS]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> You return Mostognir's level gaze, before replying, "I hear a lie wrapped in this truth, Dvergr King. If I am to be your agent in this, it will be with full knowledge of your dealings with Sigyn. I will not be blind." Mostognir starts to his feet and hurls his cup at you! "How DARE you, Manling!" He roars, "You would challenge the word of the King of all Svartalfheim in his own house? I will reave your head from your shoulders where you stand!" You do not move, but continue to glare at the tempermental king. He holds your gaze only a few moments longer before dropping his eyes with a scowl. "Very well. I did not send Sigyn away. We made plans together. She was to take Ymir's flesh and rewrite history, but into it she would write also the triumph of the Dvergr over half of creation. She would rule Asgard and the high kingdoms as queen, and I would rule the lands of men and giants. Odin is an arrogant fool, and Frigga little better. Ymir's flesh was a small price to pay for the ascendancy of my peoples to their rightful place as rulers of many realms. But I was deceived. She did not return, and when the signs showed in the Eitr, I knew I was betrayed. But this changes nothing. Still the need for secrecy is great, and still your need for haste matches mine. Your life is now bound to the fate of the Dvergr, Maor. I hope you are able..." ADD THE D20 FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 21->DAY 21C]]<h2>THE EVERSTEPS</h2> You climb to the heart of Asgard, following a golden thread tracing a line across your vision that guides your steps. By and by you wend your way to the heart of the city, where Ygdrassil's high branch supports the towering majesty of Asgard. Into this branch, ancient steps run down and into the heartwood of the tree, towards the roots. The thread of your path points you thence... (input-box: bind $TrollNumber1,"") [[Submit Number|Troll Input]]<h2>TURN BACK AND ASCEND THE STAIRS</h2> You turn, and despite all logic, begin to ascend the stairs you had just descended. And in a mere few ascended steps you find the stairs end, widening into a chamber where the tree's grain weaves on the walls into a dazzling pattern of infinite complexity. Lines cross and weave in a maze of delightful dances, unforming to your eye, only to flower into a new pattern again. By and by your eye is drawn to where all patterns converge, arching overhead and downwards to a glowing, shining orb at the chamber's center, wreathed round with the pattern that paints the walls: the Seed of Ygdrassil! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 22->DAY22E]]You pick up your cat and place it upon your head. Surely there is no greater armor than an angry cat on the battlefield! This will strike fear into even the boldest of enemies! The quarter-master walks in just then and sees you putting the cat on your head. He shakes his head and removes the cat from yours. "You gotta lay off the sauce, boss" he says, and redirects your attention to ACTUAL pieces of armor on the wall... [[DAY 3]]You select a dead chicken from the wall and draw it from its scabbard. "This is definitely a good decision." You think. The quarter-master comes in at that moment, and sees you standing naked in the armory, brandishing a dead chicken. He guides you slowly back to bed, and strongly recommends that in future you refrain from drinking honeyflower mead after dusk... Odin's voice comes to you again, "Ok. Let's try this again..." You turn to the two remaining soldiers, and smile with bravado. Their leers turn to scowls, but they look less sure of themselves. [[Continue|ThievesDMG]]<h2>VICTORY!</h2> You smile, and this time you advance on your remaining assailants, tall and menacing. Those still able back away, but do not run. You time your final attack, feinting to the side, then redirecting the momentum of the soldiers when they fall for your trap! You twist their weapons, sending them barreling into each other! You shove them violently, and they tumble to the ground in a chaotic mass of flailing limbs. You slam your (print:$weapon) into the chest of one, then the other, and shout in your rage, "BEGONE THIEVES AND PARASITES, OR I WILL SATE THE HUNGER OF MY BLADE WITH YOUR LIVES!" There is a moment of silence, then those who can scrabble to their feet and flee, streaming blood from their wounds. Those too wounded lie where they have fallen. "You will regret this, Maor!" They shout! You draw a shaky breath as you pick up the remainder of your equipment where it was piled in the gutter. The battle is over. You've won! (link: "Continue")[ No sooner has the dust settled from the strife, than a troop of Dvergr warriors appear at the mouth of the alley, drawn by the commotion. Behind them a curious crowd has gathered. A Dvergr with an air of authority steps forward, taking in the carnage of the alley. Behind you, the soldiers you've wounded lie groaning and cursing. Some lie still. His expression hardens. "Start talking, manling. By rights I should kill you where you stand, and I will if I don't like what you say." You stand and call out to all the assembled, "I come by the will of Odin and His Beloved, with a purpose greater than any of us! I did not seek violence upon the ones you see slain here. They poisoned my cup and sought to rob me and kill me. I should as well ask you why the Dvergr offer such scant hospitality to guests of their city. Or are the soldiers of Svartalfheim commissioned to disorder and injustice?" The assembled soldiers shift in anger at your words, but a murmur of approbation can be heard in the assembled crowd behind. The Dvergr pauses, weighing the situation. Then he advances on you and barks a sharp command. The soldiers turn and begin forcibly dispersing the crowd. You see the flash of a dagger blade, drawn for your benefit... "The gods have chosen and blessed each adventurer that will go out, one to each realm, to find the source of the blight. I have chosen you, Maor. Your steadfastness and hope fill my heart with joy. Take with you my blessing!" And he places around your neck the amulet of three horns that is his symbol. It shines and rests warm against your chest. Then he steps aside and gestures to your waiting ship. "It is time - I will very soon open the way to the Bifrost. Make ready, and watch for horizon to split. Fair winds, Warrior!" [[CONTINUE->TrollDMG]]<h2>DEFEAT!</h2> You've wounded your foe greviously, but not mortally, and he knows he has you now. He grins, and as his fist descends, your vision narrows and fades to black. But you do not die, and even the deep and visceral pain you should feel clears like mist at the dawn in merest moment. But no sun rise comes. Instead, you are spinning and falling endlessly down and down and down - the colors of the worlds mix and mingle as you tumble for what seems an eternity. And then you are not falling, you are sinking in a mire that pulls at your boots and clings to your skin like the touch of the dead. And all around you stretch the endless windswept wastelands. You rise, and while the fearsome wounds from your combat are still present, they are as far-away reminders of a fading nightmare. The blood that should be coursing from them is frozen in time, like a winter stream. What is this place? (link: "Continue")[The mud near you coalesces like fingers grasping at the air, growing and congealing towards the shape of a body. The runnels of muck resolve into features, first vague, then clear and alive. Then an arm reaches out from it, becoming a tendril, that wraps with the inevitability of a snake's coils around your neck. A face emerges and turns to you - the face of a goddess: beautiful and hollow and terrible. A voice like a final whisper permeates your mind, ""Who are you, and what business have you in the realm of the dead?" (link: "Continue")[ Suddenly, the bloody waters all around you grow and twist towards the shape of a body. The elements rise and resolve into features, first vague, then clear and alive. Then an arm reaches out from it and becoming a tendril that wraps with the inevitability of a snake's coils around your neck. A face emerges and turns to you: the beautiful and terrible and entirely otherworldly face of a God who has been irritated. A voice speaks, with the low musical weight of power: "Who are you, and why do you trouble this realm. Speak quickly, for you have slain one of the beasts in my care, and I would as soon break you as hear you." [[CONTINUE->VAN1]] ]Suddenly and everywhere the voice of Odin rings, as it did in your head a scant few days ago. "Stay your anger, brother Njord. This one is here by my hand. You have surely felt the tremblings of the World Tree. You know as well as I that Ygdrassil's life hangs in the balance, and with it our fates as well. Listen to the warrior. They will speak in my stead, for my power wanes, and my voice fails at this reach." And his presence is gone. Njord turns his haughty gaze upon you, "Speak quickly warrior. My patience with you and the meddlings of Odin wears thin." KEEP THE DIE (A D12) FROM TODAY FOR YOUR INSPIRATION POOL - ODIN'S PRESENCE IS WITH YOU! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 13->DAY 13V]] ]<h2>APPEAL TO A HIGHER AUTHORITY</h2> You place your blade in the ground and push yourself up by the handle, before speaking. "You know that I come in Odin's name and on his errand. Tell me God of Vanaheim, Would you dare defy him openly? If he dies and all is lost, you too will be lost and consumed by Ragnarok come before it's time. If he lives and Ygrassil grows again, he will again sit enthroned as all-father in Asgard, and you will join Loki below the serpent's sting. Choose wisely - it matters not to me." You know I have the ear of the All-Father, and that I come by his will for the saving of all things. Your fate is bound up with his and with mine. Let us join in common cause, that Ragnarok might not come before it's appointed time. If the World Tree should fall, all fall, and there will be none the wiser that we have dealt. If it should come to pass that I and my kin should cure the blight on Ygdrassil, I shall speak with honeyed words to Odin of your aid in this. I shall see to it that in all of Asgard and Midgard, and the realms beyond, that all is well because the strong hand of Njord was a present help at the hour of need, and worthy of a seat of honor. You shall be set at Odin's right hand, and your wisdom will be carried beyond the borders of Vanaheim and into the far corners of the Nine Worlds. What have you to lose?" "I need neither your patience nor your permission, blind little god-let. I fear no ending you might inflict on me. You are a small God of a small world, so wrapped in his own thoughts that he will be an unending source of contempt to all generations. No, I fear only that I should not take my place amongst the warriors of Asgard, and that The World Tree should die of the blight you well know afflicts it. Lend me your aid, or begone and leave me to my work, but don't waste my time when the honorof my house is needed by your betters for higher tasks." His eyes grow flat, and the colors of Vanaheim that swirl on him intensify to brilliance. "No ant of Midgard should dare speak to me so. Why would I care for the will of Odin, or trust such a fragile and flawed vessel for his purposes. This is trickery, and ill-conceived trickery at that. Flee, vermin. Go back to your hovel. I will grant you the mercy of 100 beats of the wolf's heart before I lift my voice and turn all of Vanaheim against you. Flee and call upon the Old Fool to save your skin if he can. But I doubt he will." You turn, and run desperately away from the grove and into the darkened wood around you, not knowing where you are or where to go. [[CONTINUE->DAY 14VD]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> Njord regards you steadily for long moments, finally saying: "Very well, mortal. Speak you piece." You sit at table, and relay to Njord what Odin told you, of the failing of the World Tree, and of your journey thus far. When done he sits a long time, deep in thought. [[CONTINUE->DAY 14VS]](set: _inputNum to (num: $VDirNumber)) Process Input (if: _inputNum is 1)[ (set: $Vdir to "VNorth") (go-to: "VNorth") ] (else-if: _inputNum is 2)[ (set: $Vdir to "VWest") (go-to: "VWest") ] (else-if: _inputNum is 3)[ (set: $Vdir to "VSouth") (go-to: "VSouth") ] (else-if: _inputNum is 4)[ (set: $Vdir to "VEast") (go-to: "VEast") ] (else:)[ (set: $Vdir to "Error") (go-to: "Potato is not a direction...3") ] [[VNorth]] [[VWest]] [[VSouth]] [[VEast]] [[Potato is not a direction...3]]You consider tasting the water on your tongue, and though your thirst is great, you shut your mouth firmly, and set your eyes to the moving horizon. Only a fool trusts strange seas for favor. PRUDENCE IS THE BETTER PART OF VALOR: YOU SUFFER NO ILL EFFECTS! You continue on into the vibrantly colored wilderness of Vanaheim. The air is warm and alive with scents and sound. Slowly changes creep into the edges of your perception. Your awareness broadens. You see the coursing of life through trees and grass. The trails through the air of bird and insect. The light left by the footprints of deer on the ground. THE EITR OF VANAHEIM DWELLS IN YOUR BLOOD AND YOUR BONES. [[DAY 10->DAY 10VE]]You raise your soaking sleeve to your lips with no small fear, but the water's taste is sweet! It is fresh and clear as a mountain stream, and you find your limbs suffused with warmth. And more - it is as if the scales fall from your eyes, your vision awakened. Of a sudden you see the coursing of life in the currents and waves. The trails through the water of strange and wonderful fish. The very sea floor, teeming with life of impossible and infinite color. It is a deep red-gold, like the honey of Midgard but brighter, like a precious stone, and fragrant beyond imagining. Go with my blessing, and make right the wrongs I have wrought by my weakness." Yrsa stalks from the woods and sits, regarding you with knowing eyes. She is as solid as the unmoving earth, and the Eitr flows around her as an adornment of royalty. ADD A REROLL ON ANY DICE ROLL TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! (set: $animal to "Yrsa") [[CONTINUE TO DAY 16->DAY 16VT]]<h2>THE BEAR</h2> A great she-bear stalks from the woods and sits, regarding you with knowing eyes. She is as solid as the unmoving earth, and the Eitr flows around her as an adornment of royalty. You know this beast from the elders' stories: This is Yrsa, she-wolf protector of Vanaheim. Her coming is blessing indeed. With her as your companion, the wrath of Njorn cannot touch you. ADD A REROLL ON ANY DICE ROLL TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[GO TO DAY 15->DAY 15VS]]<h2>SUCCESS!</h2> Njord is hiding something. When he said 'She left soon afer', the merest flicker of shame crossed his face. You confront Njord in his lie. "If the world is ending, let it not end on a falsehood uttered in shame. I will swear on the honor of my house that the knowledge of it will not pass my lips." Njord shifts as if the world's weight is too much to bear. "That meeting was not the last I saw of Sigyn. She came again, begging to wander the world alone. She said she desired an hour's peace in my world, a rest away from her ministrations to Loki. I granted her request. She is loyal to her sworn oath of marriage, even to one condemned to eternal suffering, and that is greatly to be admired. Skadi, who is my betrothed, cares nothing for the beauties of my world, or the bonds of loyalty and love, and I hurt. How could I refuse an hour's peace to one so loyal?" ADD THE D20 FROM TODAY TO YOUR INSPIRATION POOL! [[CONTINUE TO DAY 15->DAY 15VS]]The glowing orbs are now upon you, and you freeze, hoping perhaps by your stillness to shake off their interest. But they still approach, slowly and inexorably. The closest of them hovers before your face, before touching you! It's touch is like a jolt of fire, and immediately you swing your arm up and bat it away! It rises from where your strike threw it, and all the orbs begin whirring and flying through the air, with the low hum of a distant swarm of wasps! You ready your (print:$weapon) and as the closest orb approaches, you attack wildly! ROLL A D20 TO ATTACK! With horror you realize that the touch of this creature did not just bring pain - it has taken memories! Where once the name and face of your father and mother sat in a place of honor in your mind, there is only a maddening absence! [[CONTINUE->WispDMG]]<h2>DEFEAT!</h2> You've scattered the shining creatures repeatedly, but it is not enough to dissuade them. They bear down on you, and you feel hope abandon you. Your wild attacks do nothing, and one then the another of the creatures makes contact. Your vision narrows and fades to black, memories fragmenting like ash from a fire. But you do not die, and even the deep and visceral pain you should feel clears like mist at the dawn in merest moment. But no sun rise comes. Instead, you are spinning and falling endlessly down and down and down - the colors of the worlds mix and mingle as you tumble for what seems an eternity. And then you are not falling, you are sinking in a mire that pulls at your boots and clings to your skin like the touch of the dead. And all around you stretch the endless windswept wastelands. You rise, and while the fearsome wounds from your combat are still present, they are as far-away reminders of a fading nightmare. The blood that should be coursing from them is frozen in time, like a winter stream. What is this place? (link: "Continue")[The mud near you coalesces like fingers grasping at the air, growing and congealing towards the shape of a body. The runnels of muck resolve into features, first vague, then clear and alive. Then an arm reaches out from it, becoming a tendril, that wraps with the inevitability of a snake's coils around your neck. A face emerges and turns to you - the face of a goddess: beautiful and hollow and terrible. A voice like a final whisper permeates your mind, "Who are you, and what business have you in the realm of the dead?" [[[[CONTINUE->HEL1]]]] ]<h2>HIT!</h2> Your attack makes contact! [[Continue|WispDMG]]<h2>VICTORY!</h2> You roar your defiance at the creatures and bat them aside in desperate rage. And it appears to work! They creatures retreat into the woods, in search of less difficult prey perhaps! You draw a shaky breath. The battle is over. You've won! But no sooner has your heart stopped beating, than the very air is rent by a great sourceless voice, that echoes through you with measured inevitability. "WHY DO YOU ATTACK THE GUARDIANS OF THIS REALM?" (link: "Continue")[ The shimmering dark of the forest is suddenly illuminated by an overwhelming living light: a shimmering, radiant presence of golden air that rises and coils into a singular, colossal form. The light resolves into features, first vague, then clear and magestic and mighty. Robes of living sunlight flow and swirl up a strong, graceful form, revealing skin that shines like polished bronze and eyes that burn with the blue of a midday sky. The great form of Freyr, Lord of Álfheim, leans towards you. His voice moves through the air, resonant like the great peal of a thousand titanic bells. "SPEAK YOUR PIECE, MAOR." [[CONTINUE->ALF1]] ]The towering, silent presence of the God Víðarr stands before you, a figure of mighty earthen strength. On his arms are the bracers of order and steadfastness, and on his feet are the infamous mighty leather boot, made from the scraps of time. "I know of your quest, Maor," he rumbles, his voice deep and solid like the bedrock of the world, "and it will test you mightily. Go with my endurance! It will steady your hand in times of turbulence, and be an unyielding foundation to you when your strength fails." And he places around your neck a silve amulet of the wolf's head that is his symbol. It rests heavy and unmoving against your chest, imbued with the quiet strength of the earth. Then he steps aside and gestures to your waiting ship. "It is time - the All-Father will soon open the way to the Bifrost. Make ready, and watch for horizon to split. Fair winds, Warrior!"
